name: Amplify Science K - Needs of Plants and Animals
description: Investigate what plants and animals need to survive and grow. Students observe living things, test environmental factors, and design solutions for animal care. Hands-on investigation with digital simulations. 6-8 weeks NGSS-aligned unit.
stem_fields: Life Science, Biology, Ecology, Environmental Science

name: Amplify Science K - Pushes and Pulls
description: Explore forces through investigation and design challenges. Test how pushes and pulls affect object motion. Design and build solutions using force concepts. Includes physical materials and digital modeling. 6-8 weeks.

name: Amplify Science K - Sunlight and Weather
description: Investigate how sunlight affects Earth and causes weather patterns. Observe sky phenomena, track weather changes, and model seasonal patterns. Combines outdoor observation with digital tools. 6-8 weeks unit.

name: Amplify Science 1 - Light and Sound
description: Investigate properties of light and sound through investigation. Design communication devices using light and sound. Study waves, vibration, and transmission. Interactive simulations and hands-on experiments. 8 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 1 - Animal and Plant Defenses
description: Explore how organisms use body parts and behaviors to survive. Study camouflage, mimicry, and defense mechanisms. Biomimicry design challenge. Includes observation activities and digital modeling. 8 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 1 - Spinning Earth
description: Investigate patterns in sky including day/night cycle and seasonal changes. Model Earth's rotation and orbit. Study how sunlight affects different locations. Digital simulations and hands-on modeling. 8 weeks.
stem_fields: Astronomy, Earth Science, Space Science, Patterns

name: Amplify Science 2 - Properties of Materials
description: Test and compare material properties. Design solutions using appropriate materials for specific purposes. Investigate reversible and irreversible changes. Hands-on testing with digital documentation. 8 weeks.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Materials Science, Engineering, Physical Science

name: Amplify Science 2 - Plant and Animal Relationships
description: Study how plants and animals depend on each other and environment. Investigate pollination, seed dispersal, and interdependence. Design pollinator gardens. Outdoor investigations and digital simulations. 8 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 2 - Changing Landforms
description: Investigate how wind, water, and ice shape Earth's surface. Model erosion and weathering processes. Design solutions to prevent erosion. Includes landform mapping and change modeling. 8 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 3 - Balancing Forces
description: Investigate balanced and unbalanced forces. Design and test structures for stability. Study magnetic forces and patterns. Engineering challenges with digital force modeling. 8-10 weeks unit.

name: Amplify Science 3 - Inheritance and Traits
description: Study how traits pass from parents to offspring. Investigate variation within species and adaptation advantages. Fossil evidence of inherited traits. Includes breeding simulations and data analysis. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 3 - Weather and Climate
description: Investigate weather patterns and climate differences. Collect and analyze weather data over time. Study how climate affects living things. Digital weather simulations and data graphing. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Meteorology, Climate Science, Data Analysis

name: Amplify Science 3 - Environments and Survival
description: Study how organisms survive in different environments. Investigate adaptations, habitat requirements, and environmental changes. Design solutions for habitat protection. Field observations and digital ecosystem modeling. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 4 - Energy Conversions
description: Investigate how energy transfers and converts between forms. Study collisions, sound, light, and electrical energy. Design energy conversion devices. Hands-on experiments with digital energy modeling. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 4 - Vision and Light
description: Study how eyes detect light and enable vision. Investigate light behavior including reflection and refraction. Design optical devices. Interactive eye models and light pathway experiments. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 4 - Earth's Features
description: Investigate how Earth's surface changes through weathering, erosion, and plate tectonics. Model volcanic eruptions and earthquakes. Map geological hazards and design safety solutions. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Geology, Plate Tectonics, Natural Hazards

name: Amplify Science 4 - Waves, Energy, and Information
description: Explore how waves transfer energy and encode information. Design communication devices using light and sound waves. Study wave patterns and digital encoding. Engineering challenges with wave applications. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 5 - Patterns of Earth and Sky
description: Study Earth-Sun-Moon system and patterns in space. Investigate seasons, phases, eclipses, and star motion. Build scale models of solar system. Digital planetarium simulations. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Astronomy, Earth Science, Space Science, Patterns

name: Amplify Science 5 - Modeling Matter
description: Investigate particle nature of matter and chemical reactions. Study phase changes, conservation of mass, and molecular interactions. Conduct experiments testing matter properties. Digital particle modeling. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Matter, Physical Science, Molecular Science

name: Amplify Science 5 - Ecosystem Restoration
description: Study matter and energy flow through ecosystems. Investigate food webs, decomposition, and nutrient cycling. Design ecosystem restoration plans. Field ecology and digital ecosystem modeling. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Life Science, Ecology, Environmental Science, Conservation

name: Amplify Science 5 - Earth's Water
description: Investigate how water moves through Earth systems. Study water cycle, watersheds, and water conservation. Test water purification methods. Includes watershed mapping and digital water cycle simulation. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Hydrology, Environmental Science, Engineering

name: Amplify Science 6 - Cells and Systems
description: Study structure and function of cells, organs, and body systems. Investigate how systems work together for survival. Model cellular processes and system interactions. Microscopy and digital anatomy. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 6 - Plate Tectonics and Rock Cycling
description: Investigate plate boundaries, earthquakes, and rock formation. Model convection currents and tectonic movement. Study rock cycle and geological time. Includes rock identification and digital plate modeling. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Geology, Plate Tectonics, Geophysics

name: Amplify Science 6 - Thermal Energy
description: Study heat transfer and thermal equilibrium. Design insulation systems and cooling devices. Investigate molecular motion and temperature. Hands-on thermal experiments with particle modeling. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 6 - Weather Patterns
description: Investigate atmospheric circulation, air masses, and severe weather. Analyze weather maps and predict conditions. Study climate zones and global wind patterns. Digital weather modeling and forecasting. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, Data Analysis

name: Amplify Science 7 - Chemical Reactions
description: Investigate how substances interact and transform. Study conservation of mass, energy in reactions, and molecular rearrangement. Conduct synthesis and decomposition experiments. Digital molecular modeling. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Chemical Reactions, Physical Science, Molecular Science

name: Amplify Science 7 - Populations and Resources
description: Study population dynamics and ecosystem carrying capacity. Investigate competition, predation, and resource availability. Analyze human impact on ecosystems. Population modeling and field ecology. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Life Science, Ecology, Population Biology, Environmental Science

name: Amplify Science 7 - Rock Transformations
description: Investigate rock cycle and mineral formation processes. Study metamorphism, crystallization, and geological processes. Identify rocks and minerals. Includes geological timescale and Earth history. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 7 - Metabolism
description: Study how organisms obtain and use energy. Investigate photosynthesis, cellular respiration, and digestion. Model molecular processes in cells. Lab investigations with digital cellular modeling. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Life Science, Biology, Cellular Biology, Biochemistry

name: Amplify Science 8 - Forces and Motion
description: Investigate Newton's laws through experimentation and modeling. Study velocity, acceleration, and force relationships. Design collision safety systems. Includes motion analysis and force modeling. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 8 - Genetics
description: Study DNA structure, protein synthesis, and inheritance patterns. Investigate mutations and genetic variation. Analyze pedigrees and conduct genetic crosses. Digital DNA modeling and data analysis. 8-10 weeks.
stem_fields: Life Science, Genetics, Molecular Biology, Biotechnology

name: Amplify Science 8 - Earth History
description: Investigate fossil record and geological evidence of Earth's past. Study radiometric dating, fossil formation, and mass extinctions. Reconstruct ancient environments. Includes fossil analysis and timeline construction. 8-10 weeks.

name: Amplify Science 8 - Natural Selection and Adaptation
description: Study mechanisms of evolution and natural selection. Investigate adaptation, speciation, and biodiversity. Analyze evidence from fossils, anatomy, and DNA. Population modeling and evolutionary simulations. 8-10 weeks.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - High School STEM Recognition Award
description: Recognition program for exceptional high school seniors demonstrating outstanding achievement in STEM. Winners receive certificates and recognition from astronaut scholars. Encourages pursuit of STEM careers.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - STEM Excellence Award
description: $5,000 one-time scholarship for high school seniors planning to major in aerospace engineering, physical sciences, or related STEM fields. Must demonstrate exceptional academic achievement and passion for space exploration.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Annual Scholar Summit
description: Multi-day summit bringing together astronaut scholars, high school students, and space industry professionals. Features workshops, networking, astronaut speakers, and facility tours. Opportunity to learn from spaceflight legends.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Innovators Program
description: Year-long mentorship and project program for high school students interested in aerospace innovation. Participants develop space-related projects with guidance from engineers and astronaut scholars.
time_commitment: 5-10 hours per month for school year

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Space Exploration Essay Contest
description: Annual essay competition for high school students on topics related to space exploration, aerospace engineering, and STEM careers. Winners receive scholarships and recognition. Essays judged by astronauts and scientists.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Women in Aerospace Scholarship
description: $3,000 scholarship for female high school seniors planning to pursue aerospace engineering or space sciences. Encourages women to enter aerospace field. Recipients invited to special networking events.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Future Space Leaders Program
description: Leadership development program for high school students interested in space careers. Includes virtual workshops, guest speakers from NASA and space industry, and capstone project presentations.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - STEM Research Grant for High School
description: $1,000 research grant for high school students conducting independent STEM research related to aerospace, physics, or engineering. Includes mentorship from university researchers.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Kennedy Space Center Experience
description: One-week immersive program at Kennedy Space Center for high school students. Includes behind-the-scenes tours, meetings with engineers, astronaut Q&A, and hands-on engineering challenges.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Alumni Mentorship Network
description: Connects high school students with astronaut scholars and aerospace professionals for ongoing mentorship. Monthly virtual meetings, career guidance, and college application support.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Aerospace Design Competition
description: Annual competition where high school teams design aerospace systems or space missions. Teams present to panel of aerospace engineers and astronauts. Winners receive scholarships and recognition.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - First Generation Space Scholar Award
description: $2,500 scholarship for first-generation college students planning to major in aerospace or related STEM fields. Includes connection to mentor network and college transition support.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Virtual Space Science Series
description: Free monthly webinar series featuring astronauts, NASA scientists, and aerospace engineers. High school students learn about current space missions, career paths, and space science topics.

name: Astronaut Scholarship Foundation - Summer Aerospace Intensive
description: Two-week intensive program combining aerospace engineering workshops, rocket building, flight simulations, and college prep. Residential program at partner university with industry visits.

name: NIH - Summer Internship Program in Biomedical Research (SIP)

Students work directly with NIH scientists on cutting-edge biomedical research projects. Program includes weekly seminars, poster presentations, and networking opportunities with leading researchers.

description: Prestigious research fellowship at Yale Med for Connecticut high school students. Fellows conduct biomedical research in areas including immunology, genetics, neuroscience, and global health.

name: Boeing STEM Learning Lab
description: Hands-on STEM education program bringing Boeing engineers into classrooms to teach aerospace concepts. Students learn about flight, engineering design process, and aviation careers through interactive activities and experiments.

name: Boeing Aerospace Academy
description: Intensive summer program for high school students interested in aerospace careers. Students work with Boeing engineers on real aerospace challenges, visit production facilities, and learn about aviation technology.

name: Boeing Student Design Challenge
description: Annual competition where student teams design aerospace solutions to real-world problems. Teams receive mentorship from Boeing engineers and compete for scholarships and recognition.

name: Boeing Diversity Scholarship Program
description: Scholarship program for underrepresented students pursuing aerospace and engineering degrees. Includes mentorship opportunities, internship pathways, and career development support.

name: Boeing Manufacturing Excellence Program
description: Program introducing students to advanced manufacturing processes used in aerospace production. Students learn about composite materials, precision manufacturing, and quality control systems.

name: Boeing Future Engineers Program
description: Year-long program connecting students with Boeing engineers through mentorship, project-based learning, and career exploration. Students work on real aerospace challenges and develop technical skills.

name: Boeing Aviation STEM Curriculum
description: Comprehensive K-12 curriculum package focusing on aviation and aerospace concepts. Includes lesson plans, hands-on activities, and connections to Boeing careers and facilities.

name: Bold.org - Women in Technology Scholarship
description: $500-$5,000 scholarship for female high school students pursuing computer science or technology degrees. Open to students demonstrating passion for technology and commitment to careers in tech. Essay required describing how you will use technology to make positive impact. Preference given to underrepresented minorities in tech. Renewable annually with reapplication. Funds can be used for tuition, books, technology, or educational expenses.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Technology, Software Engineering, IT

name: Bold.org - Future Black Tech Leaders Scholarship
description: $1,000-$10,000 scholarship specifically for Black high school students pursuing computer science, software engineering, or technology fields. Must demonstrate academic achievement (minimum 3.0 GPA) and passion for technology careers. Essay describing how you will contribute to increasing Black representation in tech industry. Preference for first-generation college students and students from low-income backgrounds. Letters of recommendation optional but encouraged.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Technology, Programming

name: Bold.org - Coding for Change Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students interested in using programming to create social impact. Open to all high school students learning to code or developing software applications. Submit portfolio of coding projects or description of app/website you want to build to help your community. No minimum GPA required. Judges evaluate creativity, technical skill, and potential social impact. Perfect for self-taught programmers.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Software Development, App Development

name: Bold.org - Cybersecurity Scholars Award

name: Chegg - Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Scholarship
description: $6,500 scholarship for students interested in blockchain technology, cryptocurrency, or distributed systems. Must demonstrate understanding of blockchain concepts and applications.

name: Chegg - Atmospheric Science and Meteorology Scholarship

stem_fields: Atmospheric Science, Meteorology, Climate Science, Environmental Science

name: Chegg - Chemical Engineering Scholarship
description: $6,000 scholarship for students interested in chemical engineering or process engineering. Must demonstrate understanding of chemical processes and industrial applications.
stem_fields: Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Process Engineering, Manufacturing

name: Chegg - Women in Science Leadership Scholarship
description: $7,000 scholarship for female students pursuing science degrees with demonstrated leadership in STEM activities. Must show commitment to mentoring and inspiring other women in science.

name: Chegg - Network Engineering and Administration Scholarship
description: $5,000 scholarship for students interested in network engineering, system administration, or IT infrastructure. Must demonstrate understanding of networking concepts and protocols.
stem_fields: Network Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science, Systems Administration

name: Chegg - Food Science and Technology Scholarship
description: $4,500 scholarship for students interested in food science, food technology, or nutrition science. Must demonstrate interest in food systems and safety.

name: Chegg - Agricultural Engineering Scholarship
description: $5,500 scholarship for students interested in agricultural engineering, precision agriculture, or farm technology. Must demonstrate understanding of technology applications in agriculture.

name: Chegg - Forensic Science Scholarship
description: $5,000 scholarship for students interested in forensic science, crime scene investigation, or forensic chemistry. Must demonstrate interest in applying science to criminal justice.

name: Chegg - User Experience and Design Scholarship
description: $4,000 scholarship for students interested in UX/UI design, human-computer interaction, or product design. Must submit portfolio demonstrating design thinking and user-centered design.
stem_fields: UX/UI Design, Computer Science, Design, Psychology

name: Chegg - Quantum Computing Scholarship
description: $8,000 scholarship for students interested in quantum computing, quantum physics, or quantum information science. Must demonstrate strong foundation in physics and advanced mathematics.
stem_fields: Quantum Computing, Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics

name: Chegg - Low-Income STEM Scholar Award
description: $10,000 scholarship for high school students from low-income families pursuing STEM degrees. Must demonstrate financial need, academic achievement, and perseverance. Available to students of all backgrounds.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - EV3 Intro to Programming
description: Introduction to robotics programming using LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3. Learn sensors, motors, programming logic, and problem-solving. Free curriculum with lesson plans, videos, and student activities. No prior experience required.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - EV3 Advanced Programming
description: Advanced EV3 programming covering data structures, advanced sensors, multi-threading, and complex algorithms. Build sophisticated autonomous robots. Free curriculum for experienced students.
stem_fields: Robotics, Computer Science, Advanced Programming, Algorithms

name: CMU Robotics Academy - VEX IQ Curriculum
description: Complete VEX IQ robotics curriculum for elementary and middle school. Build and program VEX IQ robots through project-based challenges. Includes engineering notebooks and competition preparation.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - VEX V5 Curriculum
description: High school VEX V5 robotics curriculum with advanced C++ programming. Design, build, and program competitive robots. Free comprehensive curriculum with teacher guides and student workbooks.
stem_fields: Robotics, Computer Science, C++, Engineering Design

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Computer Science 2 (CS2)
description: Introductory computer science curriculum using robotics as teaching platform. Programming fundamentals, algorithms, data structures, and computational thinking. Language-agnostic concepts with robot implementation.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Algorithms, Computational Thinking

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Robotics Engineering 1
description: Foundational robotics engineering curriculum covering mechanical design, sensors, actuators, and control systems. Hands-on projects building functional robots. Engineering design process emphasized.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Robotics Engineering 2
description: Advanced robotics engineering with kinematics, dynamics, path planning, and computer vision. Design complex autonomous systems. Prepares students for collegiate-level robotics.
stem_fields: Robotics, Advanced Engineering, Computer Vision, Kinematics

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Arduino Robotics
description: Learn robotics and electronics using Arduino platform. Build sensors, actuators, and complete robot systems from scratch. Programming in C/C++ with hardware integration.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Python for Robotics
description: Learn Python programming through robotics applications. Variables, loops, functions, and object-oriented programming with robot control. Modern language for versatile applications.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Intro to AI and Machine Learning
description: Introduction to artificial intelligence and machine learning using robotics. Teach robots to learn from data, recognize patterns, and make decisions. Accessible AI concepts for high schoolers.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Robotics, Computer Science

name: CMU Robotics Academy - LEGO WeDo Elementary Robotics
description: Elementary robotics curriculum using LEGO WeDo 2.0. Introduce young students to engineering, programming, and scientific inquiry through age-appropriate projects. Visual block programming.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - CS2N (Computer Science Student Network)
description: Free online community and learning platform for K-12 computer science and robotics. Access curriculum, competitions, badges, and connect with global student network. Track progress and achievements.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Robotics, Online Learning, Community

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Robotics Fundamentals
description: Foundational robotics course covering robot anatomy, sensors, motors, programming basics, and engineering design. Platform-agnostic concepts applicable to any robotics system. Middle school entry point.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Autonomous Vehicles
description: Explore self-driving car technology through robotics. Learn sensors for navigation, path planning algorithms, obstacle avoidance, and decision-making systems. Current real-world applications.
stem_fields: Robotics, Autonomous Systems, Computer Science, Engineering

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Robot Soccer
description: Build and program robots to play autonomous soccer. Learn team coordination, strategy, real-time decision making, and competitive robotics. Engaging project-based curriculum.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Robotics Competitions Prep
description: Prepare teams for robotics competitions including FIRST, VEX, and RoboCup. Competition strategy, robot optimization, team management, and documentation. Supplemental to core curriculum.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Computational Thinking Through Robotics
description: Develop computational thinking skills using robots as learning tools. Problem decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, and algorithm design. Foundations for computer science.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Robotics Challenges and Badges
description: Online robotics challenges and digital badges through CS2N platform. Students complete projects, earn achievements, and demonstrate skills. Motivational system integrated with curriculum.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - Introduction to Drones
description: Explore drone technology and aerial robotics. Programming flight paths, sensor integration, and applications from photography to delivery. Hands-on projects with educational drones.

name: CMU Robotics Academy - STEM Equity and Inclusion Initiative
description: Programs and resources promoting equity in robotics education. Support for underrepresented students, girls in STEM, and first-generation learners. Scholarships and outreach programs available.

name: Learn Python 3
description: Learn the basics of Python 3, one of the most powerful, versatile, and in-demand programming languages today. Build foundational programming skills through interactive lessons and projects.

name: Learn Java
description: Learn Java programming fundamentals including object-oriented programming concepts. Java is widely used in enterprise applications and Android development.

name: Learn JavaScript
description: Learn JavaScript fundamentals and start building interactive web applications. JavaScript is essential for modern web development and used across the tech industry.

name: Learn HTML & CSS
description: Learn the fundamentals of web development with HTML and CSS. Create and style your own websites from scratch using the building blocks of the web.

name: Learn SQL
description: Learn SQL to communicate with databases and analyze data. SQL is essential for data analysis and used by virtually every company that stores data.

name: Learn R
description: Learn R programming for statistical analysis and data visualization. R is widely used in data science, research, and statistical computing.

name: Data Scientist Career Path
description: Learn Python, SQL, statistics, and machine learning to become a data scientist. Build a portfolio of data science projects and gain job-ready skills through hands-on practice.

name: Web Development Career Path
description: Learn front-end and back-end web development skills including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Node.js, and databases. Build full-stack web applications.

name: Computer Science Career Path
description: Learn fundamental computer science concepts including algorithms, data structures, and programming principles. Build a strong foundation for advanced CS studies.

name: Learn React
description: Learn React, a powerful JavaScript library for building user interfaces. Create dynamic and interactive web applications with component-based architecture.

name: Learn Git & GitHub
description: Learn version control with Git and collaborative coding with GitHub. Essential skills for any programmer working on projects individually or in teams.

name: Learn Machine Learning
description: Introduction to machine learning concepts using Python. Learn supervised learning, data preprocessing, and model evaluation techniques for beginners.

name: Learn Command Line
description: Master the command line interface to navigate file systems, manage files, and run programs efficiently. Essential skill for all programmers and developers.

name: Build a Website with HTML, CSS, and GitHub Pages
description: Hands-on project course where students build and deploy a personal website using HTML, CSS, and GitHub Pages. Learn web development through practical application.

name: Create Interactive Websites with JavaScript
description: Build interactive websites using JavaScript DOM manipulation. Learn to create dynamic web pages that respond to user interactions and events.

name: codeSpark Academy - The Foos Puzzles
description: Interactive coding puzzles using lovable Foos characters. Learn sequencing, loops, and logic through word-free interface. Over 1,000 puzzles teaching programming fundamentals to pre-readers ages 5-9.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Logic, Problem Solving

name: codeSpark Academy - Game Maker
description: Create original games using visual programming. Design characters, backgrounds, and game mechanics without reading. Share creations with safe kid-friendly community. Develop creativity and computational thinking.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Game Design, Programming, Creativity

name: codeSpark Academy - Story Maker
description: Build interactive stories with coding blocks. Combine storytelling with programming to create animated narratives. Develop literacy and coding skills simultaneously through creative expression.

name: codeSpark Academy - Daily Challenges
description: New coding challenges every day to maintain engagement and skill development. Progressive difficulty adapting to child's level. Builds coding habit through consistent practice with fresh content.

name: codeSpark Academy - Coding Concepts Curriculum
description: Structured curriculum teaching sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, and debugging. Research-backed progression aligned to K-5 computer science standards. No-text interface perfect for pre-readers and English language learners.

name: codeSpark Academy - Parent Dashboard
description: Comprehensive parent dashboard tracking child progress, skill development, and time spent. View completed projects, coding concepts mastered, and areas for growth. Weekly progress reports via email.
stem_fields: Educational Technology, Parent Engagement, Progress Tracking

name: codeSpark Academy - Free Trial
description: Free trial period to explore full platform features. Access puzzles, game maker, and story maker with no commitment. Test if platform fits child's learning style before subscribing.

name: codeSpark Academy - Offline Mode
description: Download content for offline play on tablets. Continue learning without internet connection during travel or areas with limited connectivity. Syncs progress when back online.

name: codeSpark Academy - Kid-Safe Community
description: Moderated community where children can share games and stories safely. No chat or personal information sharing. Inspire creativity by playing creations from kids worldwide. COPPA-compliant safety.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Community Learning, Digital Citizenship

name: codeSpark Academy - Multi-Child Accounts
description: One subscription supports up to 3 children with individual profiles and progress tracking. Each child has personalized learning path and saves own creations. Family-friendly pricing.

name: Computer Science Fundamentals - Course A
description: Introduction to computer science for pre-readers. Students learn programming concepts through visual programming blocks, focusing on sequencing, loops, and problem-solving skills.

name: Computer Science Fundamentals - Course B
description: Programming fundamentals for early readers using visual blocks. Students explore basic programming concepts including loops, events, and simple algorithms through interactive activities.

name: Computer Science Fundamentals - Course C
description: Intermediate programming concepts for elementary students. Introduction to loops, conditionals, and functions through drag-and-drop programming in engaging games and activities.

name: Computer Science Fundamentals - Course D
description: Advanced elementary programming covering nested loops, functions with parameters, and basic algorithms. Students create interactive stories and games while learning logical thinking.

name: CS Discoveries
description: Comprehensive computer science curriculum for middle school covering programming, web development, data science, and artificial intelligence through hands-on projects and creative expression.

name: CS Principles
description: AP Computer Science Principles equivalent course covering programming, algorithms, data representation, cybersecurity, and the impact of computing on society through collaborative projects.

name: Hour of Code - Minecraft
description: One-hour introduction to programming using Minecraft characters and environments. Students learn basic coding concepts through block-based programming in a familiar gaming context.

name: Hour of Code - Star Wars
description: Programming introduction featuring Star Wars characters and storylines. Students use visual programming blocks to guide BB-8 and other characters through coding challenges and adventures.

name: Hour of Code - Frozen
description: Creative programming activity using Disney Frozen characters. Students learn basic programming concepts while creating interactive animations and controlling character movements through code.

name: CS Fundamentals Express
description: Accelerated introduction to computer science fundamentals combining concepts from multiple grade levels. Perfect for students who want to quickly learn basic programming concepts.

name: App Lab Programming
description: JavaScript programming environment for creating mobile apps and interactive websites. Students learn text-based coding while building real applications with user interfaces and data storage.

name: Web Lab Development
description: HTML, CSS, and web development fundamentals for creating responsive websites. Students learn front-end web development skills through hands-on projects and real-world applications.

name: Game Lab Programming
description: JavaScript-based game development environment for creating interactive 2D games. Students learn programming concepts through game design including sprites, animations, and user interaction.

name: CS in Algebra
description: Integration of computer science concepts with algebra curriculum. Students learn programming while reinforcing mathematical concepts through computational thinking and problem-solving activities.

name: CS in Science
description: Computer science integration with science curriculum using computational modeling and data analysis. Students explore scientific concepts through programming and simulation activities.

name: Coding Rooms - Introduction to Python (Elementary)
description: Beginner-friendly Python course for elementary students. Learn variables, basic input/output, simple loops, and fundamental programming concepts. Visual and interactive exercises with collaborative coding features.

name: Coding Rooms - Advanced Python Programming
description: Advanced Python for high school students. Object-oriented programming, file handling, modules, libraries, APIs, and data structures. Prepare for AP Computer Science Principles and college-level programming.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Python, Software Engineering

name: Coding Rooms - Introduction to Java
description: Begin Java programming with syntax, variables, operators, control flow, and methods. Build console applications and learn object-oriented concepts. Aligned with AP Computer Science A curriculum.

name: Coding Rooms - AP Computer Science A Prep
description: Complete AP Computer Science A exam preparation course. Java programming covering all AP CSA topics: inheritance, polymorphism, recursion, data structures, algorithms, and searching/sorting. Practice AP-style questions.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Java, AP Test Prep

name: Coding Rooms - AP Computer Science Principles
description: AP CSP curriculum covering computational thinking, programming fundamentals, internet technologies, data analysis, and impact of computing. Language-agnostic concepts with Python implementation. Prepare for AP CSP exam.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Computational Thinking, AP Test Prep

name: Coding Rooms - JavaScript for Beginners
description: Introduction to JavaScript programming and web development. Learn variables, functions, DOM manipulation, events, and interactive web pages. Build browser-based projects and games.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, JavaScript, Web Development

name: Coding Rooms - HTML & CSS Web Fundamentals
description: Web development foundations with HTML and CSS. Create structured web pages, style with CSS, responsive design basics, and portfolio projects. Visual introduction to web technologies.

name: Coding Rooms - C++ Programming Fundamentals
description: Introduction to C++ programming language. Learn syntax, pointers, memory management, standard library, and object-oriented programming. Strong foundation for systems programming and competitive coding.

name: Coding Rooms - Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Computer science fundamentals covering arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, graphs, sorting, searching, and algorithm analysis. Essential for competitive programming and technical interviews.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Algorithms, Data Structures, Problem Solving

name: Coding Rooms - Python Game Development
description: Create games using Python and Pygame library. Learn game loops, sprites, collision detection, animation, sound, and game design principles. Build classic arcade games and original projects.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Python, Game Design

name: Coding Rooms - Web Development with Flask
description: Build web applications using Python Flask framework. Learn routing, templates, forms, databases, user authentication, and deployment. Create full-stack web projects.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Web Development, Python, Full-Stack Development

name: Coding Rooms - Introduction to SQL and Databases
description: Database fundamentals with SQL. Learn queries, joins, database design, normalization, and data manipulation. Work with real datasets and build data-driven applications.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Database Management, SQL, Data Science

name: Coding Rooms - Python Data Science Basics
description: Introduction to data science with Python. Learn NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib for data analysis and visualization. Work with real datasets, clean data, create charts, and derive insights.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Data Science, Python, Statistics, Mathematics

name: Coding Rooms - Machine Learning Fundamentals
description: High school introduction to machine learning with Python. Learn supervised learning, regression, classification, neural networks basics using scikit-learn. Build predictive models and understand AI concepts.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Python

name: Coding Rooms - Cybersecurity Basics
description: Introduction to cybersecurity concepts and ethical hacking. Learn encryption, network security, password security, common vulnerabilities, and security best practices. Hands-on security challenges.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Network Security, Ethical Hacking

name: Coding Rooms - Mobile App Development
description: Create mobile applications for iOS and Android. Learn mobile UI design, app architecture, user interaction, and app deployment. Build functional mobile apps with cross-platform frameworks.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Mobile Development, App Design, Programming

name: Coding Rooms - Git and Version Control
description: Learn professional version control with Git and GitHub. Understand repositories, commits, branches, merging, pull requests, and collaborative coding workflows. Essential developer skill.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Version Control

name: Coding Rooms - Computational Thinking and Problem Solving
description: Develop computational thinking skills through puzzles, logic problems, and algorithmic challenges. Language-agnostic approach focusing on problem decomposition, pattern recognition, and abstraction.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Computational Thinking, Logic, Problem Solving

name: Coding Rooms - Collaborative Coding Projects
description: Team-based coding projects using Coding Rooms real-time collaboration features. Students work together on larger applications, practicing agile development, code reviews, and teamwork skills.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Collaboration, Project Management

name: Art of Problem Solving (AOPS) - Alcumus
description: Free adaptive online problem-solving system for math students. Provides unlimited practice problems that adjust difficulty based on performance. Covers algebra, geometry, number theory, and more. Tracks progress and awards achievements.

name: MATHCOUNTS Competition Series
description: National middle school mathematics competition with school, chapter, state, and national levels. Includes individual and team rounds testing problem-solving and computational skills. Free to participate with school registration.

name: American Mathematics Competitions (AMC 8/10/12)
description: Series of mathematics competitions for middle and high school students. AMC 8 for grades 8 and below, AMC 10/12 for high school. Gateway to AIME and USA Math Olympiad. Annual competitions testing mathematical problem-solving.

name: USACO - USA Computing Olympiad
description: Free online computer programming competition with monthly contests throughout school year. Four divisions from Bronze to Platinum. Students solve algorithmic problems using programming. Top performers advance to training camp.

name: Science Olympiad
description: National STEM competition with 23 team events covering all science disciplines. Includes lab practicals, building events, and written tests. Competitions at regional, state, and national levels. Year-long preparation.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Earth Science, Engineering, Technology

name: Khan Academy Math Challenges
description: Free weekly math challenges for students of all levels. Problems range from elementary to advanced mathematics. Automated grading and explanations. Students earn points and badges for participation.

name: Physics Bowl
description: International high school physics competition with 40 multiple-choice questions. Division 1 for grades 10 and below, Division 2 for grades 11-12. Tests conceptual understanding and problem-solving in physics.

name: Codeforces - Competitive Programming Platform
description: Free online competitive programming platform with regular contests (2-3 per week). Rating system tracks progress. Problems range from beginner to advanced. Large community with editorials and discussions.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Algorithms, Data Structures

name: National Science Bowl
description: Academic competition testing knowledge in biology, chemistry, physics, earth science, and mathematics. Fast-paced buzzer format with regional and national competitions. Teams of four students compete.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Earth Science, Mathematics

name: Brilliant.org - Problem Solving Courses and Challenges
description: Interactive online learning platform with daily challenges in math, science, and computer science. Courses cover wide range from algebra to quantum computing. Free tier available with premium subscription option.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Data Science

name: Chemistry Olympiad (USNCO)
description: National chemistry competition for high school students. Local, national, and international levels. Tests conceptual understanding, problem-solving, and laboratory skills in chemistry. Top 20 attend study camp.

name: USA Biology Olympiad (USABO)
description: National biology competition for high school students with open, semifinal, and national finals. Tests broad biological knowledge and experimental design. Top students represent USA at International Biology Olympiad.

name: Project Euler
description: Free online platform with mathematical and computational programming problems. Over 700 problems requiring both mathematical insight and programming. Self-paced progression with increasing difficulty.

name: MathKangaroo Competition
description: International mathematics competition for students in grades 1-12. Multiple-choice format testing logical thinking and problem-solving. Administered annually in schools worldwide.

name: LeetCode - Coding Competition Platform
description: Online platform for practicing coding interview problems and participating in weekly contests. Free tier with extensive problem library. Tracks progress and provides company-specific problem sets.

name: International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) Preparation
description: Pathway to IMO through AMC, AIME, and USA(J)MO competitions. Most prestigious international mathematics competition for high school students. Free participation, year-long preparation programs available.

name: CyberPatriot - National Youth Cyber Defense Competition
description: Largest youth cybersecurity competition. Teams compete in virtual environments securing networks and systems. Multiple divisions for middle and high school. National finals in Maryland.

name: HackerRank - Competitive Programming and Challenges
description: Platform offering coding challenges, competitions, and certifications. Free access to practice problems in algorithms, data structures, AI, and more. Regular competitions with prizes.

name: Purple Comet Math Meet
description: Free online international mathematics competition for middle and high school teams. 25 problems solved over 90 minutes. Entirely online, accessible worldwide. Spring and fall competitions.

name: MIT Beaver Works Summer Institute - Online Challenges
description: Free online STEM challenges and competitions throughout the year. Topics include autonomous systems, AI, cybersecurity. Accessible to all high school students interested in engineering.

name: Kaggle Competitions for Students
description: Data science and machine learning competition platform. Free participation in competitions and learning resources. Student-friendly competitions available. Build portfolio while learning.
stem_fields: Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Programming

name: Coolmath Games - Strategy Games
description: Strategic thinking games that develop planning, resource management, and logical reasoning. Games like Bloxorz, Red Ball, and Papa's games teach sequential thinking and problem-solving through engaging gameplay.

name: Coolmath Games - Logic and Puzzle Games
description: Pure logic puzzles that develop deductive reasoning, pattern recognition, and critical thinking. Includes games like 2048, Minesweeper, and Sudoku variants that strengthen mathematical thinking without explicit computation.
stem_fields: Logic, Mathematics, Pattern Recognition, Critical Thinking

name: Coolmath Games - Skill and Timing Games
description: Hand-eye coordination games that combine reflexes with mathematical timing and spatial awareness. Games teach estimation, trajectory calculation, and precision through engaging arcade-style gameplay.

name: Coolmath Games - Number and Math Games
description: Direct mathematical skill-building through number puzzles and arithmetic challenges. Games explicitly practice addition, multiplication, division, and number theory concepts in engaging formats.

name: Coolmath Games - Geometry and Spatial Games
description: Spatial reasoning and geometric thinking games. Develop understanding of shapes, angles, transformations, and spatial relationships through interactive puzzles and construction challenges.
stem_fields: Geometry, Spatial Reasoning, Mathematics, Visual Math

name: Coolmath.com - Pre-Algebra Lessons
description: Comprehensive pre-algebra curriculum covering integers, fractions, decimals, percents, order of operations, and algebraic expressions. Interactive lessons with practice problems and clear explanations.

name: Coolmath.com - Algebra Lessons
description: Complete algebra curriculum including equations, inequalities, graphing, polynomials, factoring, quadratic equations, and systems of equations. Step-by-step tutorials with interactive examples.

name: Coolmath.com - Calculus Lessons
description: Introduction to calculus concepts including limits, derivatives, integrals, and applications. Visual explanations and interactive tools to understand fundamental calculus principles.

name: Coolmath4Kids - Elementary Math Games
description: Age-appropriate math games for young learners covering counting, basic addition/subtraction, shapes, patterns, and early problem-solving. Engaging graphics and simple controls for grades K-5.

name: Coolmath4Kids - Fun Facts and Brain Teasers
description: Mathematical fun facts, riddles, and brain teasers for elementary students. Develops curiosity about numbers, patterns, and mathematical thinking through entertaining content.

name: Coolmath Games - Physics and Engineering Games
description: Games incorporating physics concepts like gravity, momentum, friction, and energy. Bridge building, machine construction, and physics puzzles teach engineering principles through trial and error.

name: Coolmath Games - Resource Management Games
description: Business simulation and resource management games teaching optimization, budgeting, and strategic planning. Games like Papa's restaurants develop multi-tasking, prioritization, and efficiency thinking.

name: Coolmath Games - Maze and Pathfinding Games
description: Navigation puzzles and maze games that develop spatial reasoning, planning, and algorithmic thinking. Games teach graph theory concepts, shortest path problems, and systematic exploration.

name: Coolmath Games - Memory and Sequence Games
description: Pattern recognition and memory games that strengthen working memory, sequence recall, and attention to detail. Games develop mathematical pattern thinking and cognitive skills.

name: Coolmath Games - Probability and Chance Games
description: Games involving dice, cards, and probability that develop intuitive understanding of chance, odds, and statistical thinking. Learn probability concepts through game mechanics.

name: Coolmath Games - Mobile App Collection
description: Mobile versions of popular Coolmath Games available on iOS and Android. Play math and logic games on tablets and phones with touch-optimized controls for learning on the go.

name: Online Programs
description: The Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youths online programs are designed to challenge and inspire academically advanced students, providing opportunities to explore beyond their traditional school curriculum. From space colonization and crime scene investigation to creative writing and competitive math, our virtual classrooms will expand your knowledge and spark your curiosity. Led by expert instructors who are skilled at engaging bright learners, CTYs online programs offer courses year-round

name: On-Campus Summer Programs
description: Just because school is out for summer doesnt mean the learning stops. The Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth is more than a summer camp: Our on-campus summer courses bring together advanced learners from around the world to explore the arts and sciences, bioethics, engineering, public health, and more. Choose from more than 70 in-person summer courses that are all taught by expert instructors. CTYs on-campus programs allow young scholars to expand their knowledge surrounded by a community

name: Online Programs Courses
description: JohnsHopkinsUniversityEst.1876 AmericasFirstResearchUniversity

name: On-Campus Summer Programs Courses
description: JohnsHopkinsUniversityEst.1876 AmericasFirstResearchUniversity

name: Advanced Mathematics: Calculus BC

name: Computer Science: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Explore fundamental computer science concepts including data structures, algorithms, and computational thinking through hands-on programming projects.

name: Physics: Mechanics and Waves
description: Advanced study of classical mechanics, oscillations, and wave phenomena with mathematical modeling and laboratory simulations.

name: Biomedical Engineering
description: Hands-on exploration of biomedical engineering principles including biomaterials, medical device design, and tissue engineering in a laboratory setting.

name: Neuroscience

name: Robotics Engineering

name: Advanced Writing and Literature

name: International Politics and Diplomacy
description: Explore global political systems, international relations, and diplomatic strategies through simulations, debates, and policy analysis.

name: Young Scientists: Chemistry Lab
description: Introduction to chemistry concepts through safe, hands-on laboratory experiments designed for younger gifted students.

name: Mathematical Problem Solving
description: Advanced mathematical concepts and problem-solving strategies for talented young mathematicians, including number theory and geometry.

name: MIT Engineering Summer Camp for High School
description: Intensive 4-week residential program at MIT for high school students. Hands-on engineering projects in electrical, mechanical, and computer engineering. Work with MIT students and faculty on real engineering challenges.

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Summer Engineering Academy
description: Three-week residential program introducing high school students to engineering disciplines. Design projects, lab work, campus tours, and college prep. Led by Stanford faculty and graduate students.

name: Carnegie Mellon Robotics Academy Summer Camp
description: One-week day camp for middle school students focused on robotics and programming. Build and program robots, learn engineering design process. Multiple sessions throughout summer.

name: Georgia Tech Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long residential and day camps for different age groups. Topics include aerospace, biomedical, civil, and computer engineering. Hands-on projects and facility tours.

name: iD Tech Engineering and Robotics Camps
description: Week-long camps at university locations nationwide. Engineering and robotics courses for ages 7-18. Small class sizes, personalized instruction. Day and overnight options available.

name: UC Berkeley Engineering Summer Academy
description: Two-week residential program for high school students exploring engineering fields. Laboratory experiences, design projects, and guest speakers from industry. Emphasis on diversity in engineering.

name: Purdue Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps for grades 6-12 covering various engineering disciplines. Hands-on projects, lab tours, and college preparation. Multiple camp options by age and interest.
stem_fields: Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering

name: Engineering For Kids - Summer Camps
description: Franchise-based engineering camps for ages 4-14 in communities nationwide. Week-long programs covering different engineering themes. LEGO engineering, robotics, and design challenges.

name: UT Austin Engineering Summer Academy
description: Two-week residential program introducing high school students to engineering at UT Austin. Design projects, laboratory experiences, and presentations. Explore mechanical, electrical, and chemical engineering.
stem_fields: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering

name: Michigan Tech Summer Youth Programs - Engineering
description: Week-long engineering camps for middle and high school students. Topics include civil engineering, mechanical engineering, and robotics. Hands-on projects in university labs.
stem_fields: Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, Engineering

name: National Student Leadership Conference (NSLC) - Engineering
description: Multi-week residential program for high school students at university campuses. Focus on engineering leadership and career exploration. Hands-on projects and industry visits.

name: Cornell Engineering Experience for High School
description: One-week residential program exploring engineering at Cornell. Laboratory tours, hands-on projects, and college preparation workshops. Limited enrollment for personalized experience.

name: Illinois Tech Engineering Summer Program
description: Week-long day camps for Chicago-area students. Robotics, programming, and engineering design. Free or low-cost for students from underrepresented communities.

name: NASA Engineering Design Challenge Camps
description: Week-long camps at NASA visitor centers focusing on aerospace engineering. Design and test models, learn about space missions. Led by NASA educators and engineers.

name: Duke Engineering Summer Program (TIP)
description: Three-week residential program through Duke TIP for gifted students. Advanced engineering coursework and projects. College-level instruction with university credit option.

name: Penn State Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps exploring various engineering disciplines. Includes chemical, mechanical, civil, and industrial engineering options. Hands-on labs and design projects.
stem_fields: Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Industrial Engineering

name: Virginia Tech Engineering Summer Camps
description: Multiple week-long camps for grades 6-12. Topics include aerospace, biomedical, computer, and environmental engineering. Mix of design, hands-on building, and facility tours.
stem_fields: Aerospace Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Environmental Engineering

name: University of Washington Engineering Discovery Days
description: Day camps for middle schoolers exploring engineering through hands-on projects. Build bridges, design circuits, program robots. Offered throughout summer.
stem_fields: Engineering, Robotics, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering

name: Northwestern CTD Engineering Summer Programs
description: Gifted youth programs offering engineering courses at Northwestern. Multiple week options with advanced coursework. Residential and commuter options available.
source: Northwestern University Center for Talent Development

name: Texas A&M Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps for grades 6-12 across engineering disciplines. Hands-on projects, lab experiences, and team challenges. Multiple sessions throughout summer.

name: University of Michigan Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps exploring engineering fields through hands-on activities. Includes biomedical, computer, and environmental engineering options. University lab access.
stem_fields: Biomedical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Environmental Engineering

name: Johns Hopkins Engineering Innovation
description: Intensive pre-college engineering program for rising seniors. Four-week residential course covering engineering fundamentals. Team design project and college credit opportunity.

name: Cooper Union Summer STEM Program
description: Free six-week program for NYC high school students. Intensive engineering coursework, design projects, and career exploration. Focus on underrepresented students.

name: Cal Poly Engineering Summer Camps
description: Hands-on engineering camps at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo. Week-long programs covering aerospace, computer, and mechanical engineering. Learn-by-doing approach.
stem_fields: Aerospace Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering

name: Worcester Polytechnic Institute (WPI) - Frontiers Program
description: Two-week residential STEM program for rising 12th grade girls. Engineering and computer science projects, college preparation, and mentorship from women in STEM.

name: University of Colorado Boulder Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long camps for grades 6-12 exploring engineering disciplines. Hands-on labs, design challenges, and team projects. Multiple themes throughout summer.

name: NC State Engineering Summer Camps
description: Week-long day camps for grades 6-12 across engineering fields. Includes textile, aerospace, biomedical, and civil engineering options. University lab experiences.
stem_fields: Textile Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering

name: USC Viterbi Engineering Summer Programs
description: Multi-week residential program for high school students at USC. Engineering exploration, college prep, and design projects. Access to university facilities and mentors.

name: Rose-Hulman Operation Catapult
description: Three-week residential engineering research program for rising seniors. Students conduct real engineering research with faculty mentors. Intensive hands-on experience.

name: University of Maryland Engineering for HS Students
description: Week-long camps exploring engineering at UMD. Multiple topics including aerospace, robotics, and environmental engineering. Design challenges and lab experiences.

name: EPA Environmental Justice Video Challenge
description: Video competition for middle and high school students to create videos highlighting environmental justice issues and solutions in their communities, promoting awareness and action.

name: President's Environmental Youth Awards
description: Recognition program for K-12 students and youth organizations demonstrating environmental stewardship through projects that promote awareness, conservation, and environmental protection.

name: EPA Environmental Education Guidelines
description: Comprehensive guidelines and curriculum resources for K-12 environmental education, providing framework for quality environmental learning experiences and program development.

name: EPA Climate Change Education Resources
description: Educational materials, activities, and resources for students to learn about climate science, impacts, and solutions, including interactive tools and lesson plans.

name: EPA Water Quality Education Resources
description: Water quality monitoring tools, watershed education materials, and aquatic science resources for students to learn about water pollution, conservation, and protection.

name: EPA Student Environmental Internships
description: Summer internship opportunities for high school and college students to work with EPA scientists and environmental professionals on real-world environmental projects.

name: EPA Environmental Career Exploration
description: Career awareness program introducing students to environmental careers, featuring EPA professionals sharing career paths, educational requirements, and job opportunities.

name: EPA Environmental Education Grants
description: Grant program supporting innovative environmental education projects and programs that increase environmental awareness and stewardship among K-12 students and communities.

name: EPA Citizen Science Projects
description: Community-based monitoring and citizen science opportunities for students to collect environmental data, contributing to EPA research while learning scientific methods.

name: EPA Air Quality Monitoring for Students
description: Educational program teaching students to monitor and analyze local air quality using EPA tools and data, promoting understanding of air pollution and health impacts.

name: EPA Green Schools Program
description: Program helping schools reduce environmental impact through energy conservation, waste reduction, and sustainable practices while providing hands-on learning opportunities.

name: EPA Environmental Justice Community Engagement
description: Program connecting students with environmental justice communities to learn about environmental health disparities and develop solutions for environmental equity.

name: Gizmos - Fraction Garden
description: Interactive simulation exploring fraction concepts through visual garden plots. Plant flowers representing fractions, compare sizes, and find equivalent fractions. Grades 3-5 develop fraction sense through hands-on virtual manipulation.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Fractions, Visual Math, Number Sense

name: Gizmos - Area and Perimeter
description: Build and measure rectangles to explore area and perimeter relationships. Interactive grid for creating shapes and calculating dimensions. Grades 3-5 develop spatial reasoning and measurement skills.

name: Gizmos - Solving Linear Equations
description: Interactive algebra tiles for solving one and two-step equations. Visual representation of equation solving with balance method. Grades 6-8 develop algebraic thinking and equation solving strategies.

name: Gizmos - Graphing Linear Functions
description: Explore slope-intercept form by manipulating graphs and equations. Interactive coordinate plane for visualizing linear relationships. Grades 7-9 connect algebraic and graphical representations.

name: Gizmos - Pythagorean Theorem
description: Visual proof and application of Pythagorean theorem. Build right triangles and calculate missing sides. Grades 7-9 develop geometric reasoning and measurement skills.

name: Gizmos - Probability and Statistics
description: Simulate probability experiments and analyze statistical data. Roll dice, spin spinners, and collect data for analysis. Grades 6-8 develop data literacy and probabilistic thinking.

name: Gizmos - Quadratic Functions
description: Explore parabolas by manipulating coefficients in quadratic equations. Visualize vertex form, intercepts, and transformations. Grades 9-11 develop understanding of quadratic relationships.

name: Gizmos - Trigonometric Functions
description: Interactive unit circle and trig function graphs. Explore sine, cosine, and tangent relationships. Grades 10-12 develop trigonometric reasoning and function analysis.

name: Gizmos - Exponential Growth and Decay
description: Model exponential functions in real-world contexts. Simulate population growth, radioactive decay, and compound interest. Grades 9-12 apply exponential functions to authentic problems.

name: Gizmos - Calculus: Limits and Derivatives
description: Interactive exploration of limit concepts and derivative calculations. Visualize tangent lines, rates of change, and function behavior. Grades 11-12 develop calculus foundations.

name: Gizmos - Cell Structure
description: Explore plant and animal cell organelles through interactive 3D models. Identify structures and learn functions. Grades 6-8 develop cellular biology understanding.
stem_fields: Life Science, Biology, Cell Biology, Anatomy

name: Gizmos - Photosynthesis Lab
description: Simulate photosynthesis experiments varying light, CO2, and temperature. Measure oxygen production and plant growth. Grades 7-10 investigate factors affecting photosynthesis.
stem_fields: Life Science, Biology, Photosynthesis, Experimental Design

name: Gizmos - Heredity and Genetics
description: Model genetic crosses using Punnett squares and pedigrees. Explore dominant, recessive, and sex-linked traits. Grades 7-10 develop genetics problem-solving skills.
stem_fields: Life Science, Genetics, Heredity, Punnett Squares

name: Gizmos - Evolution: Natural Selection
description: Simulate natural selection in populations over generations. Adjust environmental pressures and observe trait changes. Grades 8-12 explore evolutionary mechanisms.
stem_fields: Life Science, Evolution, Natural Selection, Population Biology

name: Gizmos - Ecosystem Dynamics
description: Model food webs and energy flow through ecosystems. Adjust populations and observe trophic cascades. Grades 6-9 understand ecological relationships and stability.
stem_fields: Life Science, Ecology, Ecosystems, Food Webs

name: Gizmos - Phases of Matter
description: Explore solid, liquid, and gas states at molecular level. Heat and cool substances to observe phase changes. Grades 5-8 develop particle model understanding.
stem_fields: Physical Science, Chemistry, Matter, Phase Changes

name: Gizmos - Chemical Equations
description: Balance chemical equations and visualize molecular reactions. Model conservation of mass in chemical changes. Grades 8-10 develop chemistry problem-solving skills.

name: Gizmos - Energy Conversions
description: Trace energy transformations in mechanical systems. Simulate pendulums, roller coasters, and collisions. Grades 6-9 explore kinetic and potential energy.

name: Gizmos - Circuit Builder
description: Build series and parallel circuits with batteries, bulbs, and switches. Measure voltage, current, and resistance. Grades 7-10 explore electrical circuit concepts.

name: Gizmos - Newton's Laws of Motion
description: Experiment with forces, mass, and acceleration. Simulate collisions and predict motion outcomes. Grades 8-11 develop physics problem-solving with Newton's laws.

name: Gizmos - Rock Cycle
description: Simulate rock formation and transformation processes. Explore igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks. Grades 6-8 understand geological cycles and Earth processes.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Geology, Rock Cycle, Minerals

name: Gizmos - Plate Tectonics
description: Model plate boundaries and continental drift. Simulate earthquakes, volcanoes, and mountain formation. Grades 7-9 explore geophysical processes shaping Earth.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Geology, Plate Tectonics, Geophysics

name: Gizmos - Weather Maps and Fronts
description: Analyze weather maps, identify fronts, and predict weather patterns. Interpret meteorological data and symbols. Grades 6-9 develop weather forecasting skills.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Meteorology, Weather, Data Analysis

name: Gizmos - Water Cycle
description: Trace water movement through Earth systems. Model evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and groundwater flow. Grades 5-8 understand hydrological processes.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Hydrology, Water Cycle, Environmental Science

name: Gizmos - Solar System
description: Explore planets, orbits, and astronomical distances. Model planetary motion and compare celestial bodies. Grades 5-9 develop astronomy knowledge and scale understanding.
stem_fields: Astronomy, Space Science, Planetary Science, Physics

name: FIRST LEGO League Discover (Ages 4-6)
description: Introductory STEM program for PreK-1st grade using LEGO DUPLO. Explore real-world science and engineering challenges through hands-on activities. Introduce Core Values and celebrate discoveries at Discover showcase events. No competition component.

name: FIRST LEGO League Explore (Ages 6-10)
description: Hands-on STEM program for grades 2-4 using LEGO Education sets. Teams research a real-world problem, build motorized LEGO models, create Show Me posters, and practice Core Values. Culminates in Explore showcase festivals celebrating learning.

name: FIRST LEGO League Challenge (Ages 9-16)
description: Premier robotics competition for grades 4-8. Design, build, and program autonomous LEGO robots to complete missions on themed game field. Complete Innovation Project solving real-world problems. Present research, robot design, and demonstrate Core Values to judges. Compete at regional, state, and international championships.
stem_fields: Robotics, Engineering, Programming, Computer Science, Research

name: FIRST LEGO League Challenge - Robot Game
description: Competitive robot game component of Challenge level. Teams design, build, and program LEGO SPIKE Prime or MINDSTORMS robots to autonomously complete missions. 2.5 minute matches on themed field. Strategy, precision programming, and iterative design critical for success.

name: FIRST LEGO League Challenge - Innovation Project
description: Research and innovation component of Challenge level. Teams identify real-world problem related to season theme, research solutions, design innovative solution, and share findings with others. Develop presentation skills and scientific research methodology.

name: FIRST LEGO League Challenge - Robot Design
description: Engineering design component of Challenge level. Teams document robot mechanical design, programming strategies, and iterative improvement process. Present engineering portfolio to judges explaining design decisions, testing, and problem-solving.

name: FIRST LEGO League Core Values
description: Foundational values across all FIRST LEGO League levels: Discovery, Innovation, Impact, Inclusion, Teamwork, Fun. Teams demonstrate gracious professionalism, coopertition (cooperation+competition), and collaborative problem-solving. Core Values judging component at competitions.

name: FIRST LEGO League Coach Training and Resources
description: Comprehensive training and resources for team coaches and mentors. Online courses, curriculum guides, season materials, engineering notebooks, and community support. Access to global network of FIRST coaches and technical resources.

name: FIRST LEGO League Team Grants and Financial Aid
description: Financial assistance programs for teams facing economic barriers. Team registration grants, kit subsidies, and event fee waivers available through FIRST partnerships and regional programs. Application process for qualifying teams.

name: FIRST LEGO League Championship Advancement
description: Championship tournament pathway for top-performing Challenge teams. Advance from regional events to state/provincial championships, national events, and international championships. Invitation-based advancement recognizing excellence in all judging categories.

name: FIRST LEGO League Volunteer Program
description: Volunteer opportunities for community members to support FIRST LEGO League events. Roles include judging, refereeing, event coordination, and technical support. Training provided for all volunteer positions. Critical to expanding program reach.

name: FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC)
description: High school robotics competition where teams design, build, and program industrial-sized robots to compete in alliance-based matches. Teams receive a kit of parts and have 6 weeks to build their robot.

name: FIRST Robotics Competition - Build Season
description: Six-week robot build period where FRC teams design, prototype, and build their competition robot using the Kit of Parts and additional materials.

name: FIRST Robotics Competition - Regional Events
description: Regional competition events where FRC teams compete with their robots in alliance-based matches to qualify for championship.

name: FIRST Robotics Competition - Championship
description: Annual world championship event in Houston and Detroit for qualifying FRC teams. The ultimate robotics competition experience.

name: FIRST Tech Challenge (FTC)
description: Middle and high school robotics program where teams design and build robots using reusable parts to compete in head-to-head challenges with a sports-like atmosphere.

name: FIRST Tech Challenge - League Tournaments
description: Local league tournaments where FTC teams compete throughout the season. Teams earn ranking points to advance to championship events.

name: FIRST Tech Challenge - Super Regional Championships
description: Regional championship events where top FTC teams compete for advancement to the World Championship.

name: FIRST Tech Challenge - World Championship
description: Global championship event in Houston where the best FTC teams from around the world compete.

name: FIRST LEGO League (FLL)
description: Elementary and middle school program introducing STEM concepts through hands-on robotics and research projects using LEGO technology.

name: FIRST LEGO League Discover (Ages 4-6)
description: Introductory STEM program for youngest learners using LEGO DUPLO. Children explore science and engineering concepts through play.

name: FIRST LEGO League Explore (Ages 6-10)
description: Hands-on STEM program where teams build motorized models using LEGO WeDo 2.0 and create a poster to share their learning.

name: FIRST LEGO League Challenge (Ages 9-16)
description: Competitive robotics program where teams design and program autonomous LEGO robots and complete an innovation project.

name: FIRST LEGO League - Regional Tournaments
description: Regional tournament competitions where FLL Challenge teams compete with their robots and present innovation projects.

name: Garcia Research Scholars Program - Summer Research
description: Intensive 7-week summer research program at Stony Brook University for high school students. Work one-on-one with faculty mentors conducting authentic scientific research in biology, chemistry, physics, mathematics, computer science, or engineering. Full-time commitment developing research question, conducting experiments, analyzing data, and preparing presentations. Students receive stipend. Gain hands-on laboratory experience and develop scientific thinking. Selective admission based on academic achievement and research interest.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Academic Year Extension
description: Continuation of summer research during academic year for Garcia Scholars. Students continue working with faculty mentors part-time while attending high school. Develop research further, prepare for competitions, and work toward publications. Monthly seminars and research group meetings. Flexible scheduling around school commitments. Strengthen college applications with sustained research experience.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Biology and Life Sciences Track
description: Research opportunities in molecular biology, genetics, neuroscience, ecology, or biomedical sciences. Work in university laboratories using advanced equipment and techniques. Learn experimental design, microscopy, data analysis, and scientific communication. Projects may include studying gene expression, animal behavior, cellular processes, or disease mechanisms. Mentored by biology faculty.
stem_fields: Biology, Molecular Biology, Genetics, Neuroscience, Ecology

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Chemistry and Materials Science Track
description: Research in organic chemistry, inorganic chemistry, physical chemistry, or materials science. Conduct synthesis experiments, analyze compounds, and characterize materials. Use spectroscopy, chromatography, and computational chemistry tools. Projects may explore catalysis, drug design, nanomaterials, or environmental chemistry.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Nanotechnology
