name: Garcia Research Scholars - Physics and Astronomy Track
description: Research in theoretical or experimental physics, astronomy, or astrophysics. Study particle physics, condensed matter, optics, or cosmology. Use computational modeling, laboratory experiments, or telescope observations. Projects may investigate fundamental physics questions or applied physics applications.

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Computer Science and Mathematics Track
description: Research in algorithms, artificial intelligence, data science, cybersecurity, pure mathematics, or applied mathematics. Develop software, analyze data, or prove theorems. Projects may involve machine learning, computational biology, cryptography, or mathematical modeling.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Engineering Track
description: Research in mechanical, electrical, biomedical, or environmental engineering. Design experiments, build prototypes, and test engineering solutions. Use CAD software, fabrication equipment, and testing facilities. Projects address real-world engineering challenges.
stem_fields: Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering

name: Garcia Research Scholars - Research Symposium and Competitions
description: End-of-summer research symposium where Garcia Scholars present findings to faculty, peers, and families. Develop scientific posters and oral presentations. Support for entering research competitions including Intel ISEF, Regeneron STS, and regional science fairs. Guidance on abstracts, presentations, and competition applications.
stem_fields: Scientific Communication, Research Presentation, Competition Preparation

name: Garcia Research Scholars - College Application Support
description: Guidance leveraging Garcia research experience for college applications. Help framing research in personal statements, supplemental essays, and activity lists. Recommendation letters from faculty mentors. Support applying to selective universities and STEM programs. Resume building and interview preparation.
stem_fields: College Preparation, Career Guidance, Academic Advising

name: Girls Who Code Clubs
description: After-school and summer clubs for girls to learn computer science fundamentals, build coding projects, and develop computational thinking skills in a supportive community environment.

name: Summer Immersion Program
description: Intensive 7-week summer program for high school girls to learn programming, explore tech careers, and work on real-world projects with industry mentors and role models.

name: College Loops Program
description: Ongoing support network for Girls Who Code alumni transitioning to college, including mentorship, career guidance, and community connections throughout university years.

name: Girls Who Code Self-Paced Program
description: Free online coding curriculum and resources for girls to learn programming independently with interactive lessons, projects, and community support through digital platforms.

name: Girls Who Code Campus Programs
description: University-based programs and partnerships that bring coding education and career preparation directly to college campuses with local tech industry connections.

name: Girls Who Code Middle School Clubs
description: Age-appropriate coding clubs specifically designed for middle school girls focusing on creativity, problem-solving, and building confidence in technology through fun projects.

name: Girls Who Code High School Clubs
description: Advanced coding clubs for high school girls focusing on real-world applications, college preparation, and career exploration in computer science and technology fields.

name: HerStory Programming Curriculum
description: Culturally responsive computer science curriculum that highlights contributions of women and underrepresented groups in technology while teaching core programming concepts.

name: Girls Who Code at Home
description: Virtual programming and activities designed for girls to continue learning coding and computer science concepts from home with family-friendly projects and challenges.

name: Virtual Summer Experience
description: Online summer programming experience for girls who cannot attend in-person programs, featuring interactive coding lessons, virtual mentorship, and collaborative projects.

name: Girls Who Code Community Impact Projects
description: Capstone projects where girls use coding skills to address real community challenges, developing both technical abilities and social impact awareness through technology.

name: Hopscotch - Getting Started Tutorial
description: Introduction to block-based coding on iPad. Learn drag-and-drop programming interface, basic commands, and creating first interactive project. Ages 9-14 develop foundational coding skills through guided tutorial.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Computational Thinking, Logic

name: Hopscotch - Game Creation Projects
description: Build interactive games using visual programming blocks. Create platformers, racing games, and puzzles. Learn game mechanics, collision detection, scoring systems, and player controls. Ages 9-14 develop game design skills.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Game Design, Programming, Creativity

name: Hopscotch - Animation Studio
description: Create animated stories and interactive art. Program character movements, scene transitions, and visual effects using code blocks. Ages 9-14 combine storytelling with programming to create animated narratives.

name: Hopscotch - Interactive Art Projects
description: Code generative art and interactive designs. Use loops, variables, and drawing commands to create mathematical art, patterns, and responsive visuals. Ages 9-14 explore intersection of art and computer science.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Generative Art, Mathematics, Design

name: Hopscotch - Music and Sound Programming
description: Create musical compositions and sound effects using code. Program beats, melodies, and interactive instruments. Ages 9-14 learn sequencing, timing, and audio programming through musical projects.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Music, Audio Programming, Sequencing

name: Hopscotch - Variables and Math Projects
description: Learn programming variables through math games and calculators. Build counting apps, math quizzes, and interactive calculators. Ages 9-14 connect mathematical concepts with coding logic.

name: Hopscotch - Loops and Patterns
description: Master loop programming through pattern creation and repetitive tasks. Build spirals, tessellations, and automated behaviors. Ages 9-14 develop computational efficiency and algorithmic thinking.

name: Hopscotch - Conditionals and Logic
description: Learn if-then logic and conditional statements. Create decision-making programs, quizzes, and interactive stories with branching paths. Ages 9-14 develop logical reasoning and conditional thinking.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Logic, Conditionals, Decision Making

name: Hopscotch - Physics Simulations
description: Code physics-based games and simulations. Implement gravity, velocity, acceleration, and collision physics. Ages 9-14 apply physics concepts through game programming.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Physics, Game Physics, Simulation

name: Hopscotch - Character Design and Sprites
description: Create custom characters and sprites using built-in drawing tools. Program character behaviors, animations, and interactions. Ages 9-14 combine art and coding to build unique game assets.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Digital Art, Character Design, Animation

name: Hopscotch - Community Explore Page
description: Browse, play, and remix projects from global community. Discover trending games, featured projects, and learning from peer code. Ages 9-14 engage with collaborative learning and code remixing.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Peer Learning, Code Reading, Collaboration

name: Hopscotch - Publishing and Sharing
description: Publish projects to community for others to play and remix. Receive feedback, track plays, and build portfolio. Ages 9-14 develop confidence sharing work and receiving constructive feedback.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Digital Citizenship, Portfolio Building, Communication

name: Hopscotch - Code Remixing
description: Learn by remixing existing projects. View code from community projects, modify logic, and create variations. Ages 9-14 develop code reading skills and learn from examples.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Code Reading, Reverse Engineering, Adaptation

name: Hopscotch - Video Tutorials
description: Library of step-by-step video tutorials covering coding concepts. Learn loops, variables, conditionals, and game design through guided videos. Ages 9-14 follow along to build projects.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Video Learning, Tutorials

name: Hopscotch - Premium Subscription
description: Optional subscription unlocking advanced features including expanded character library, special effects, cloud saves, and ad-free experience. Ages 9-14 access enhanced creative tools.

name: Hopscotch - iPad App Interface
description: Touch-optimized coding on iPad. Drag-and-drop blocks, real-time preview, and intuitive interface designed for mobile. Ages 9-14 code anywhere with tablet-friendly design.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Mobile Learning, User Interface Design

name: Hopscotch - Weekly Challenges
description: Community coding challenges with themes and prompts. Participate in weekly projects, showcase creativity, and get featured. Ages 9-14 stay engaged with fresh content and friendly competition.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Creative Problem Solving, Community Engagement

name: Hopscotch - Safe Community Moderation
description: Kid-safe moderated community with no personal messaging. COPPA-compliant safety features, content filtering, and reporting tools. Ages 9-14 code in protected environment.
stem_fields: Digital Citizenship, Online Safety, Community Guidelines

name: International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF)
description: The world's largest international pre-college science competition where high school students compete with independent research projects across 22 scientific categories for awards and scholarships.

name: Regeneron Science Talent Search (STS)
description: The nation's most prestigious science competition for high school seniors, recognizing exceptional research projects and scientific potential through rigorous evaluation of research papers and projects.

name: Broadcom MASTERS (Math, Applied Science, Technology and Engineering for Rising Stars)
description: National middle school science and engineering competition recognizing excellence in project-based learning, critical thinking, communication, and collaboration among 6th, 7th, and 8th grade students.

name: Junior Science and Humanities Symposium (JSHS)
description: National STEM research competition for high school students conducting original research, with regional and national symposiums showcasing student research presentations and fostering STEM careers.

name: Regional Science Fair (ISEF Qualifying)
description: Local and regional science fairs serving as qualifying competitions for ISEF, where students present independent research projects and compete for advancement to international competition.

name: State Science Fair (ISEF Qualifying)
description: State-level science competitions that serve as the final qualifying step for ISEF, bringing together regional winners to compete for international science fair advancement and state recognition.

name: Thermo Fisher Scientific Junior Innovators Challenge
description: Middle school competition challenging teams to identify a real-world problem and use STEM skills to create an innovative solution, emphasizing collaboration and practical application of scientific knowledge.

name: Society for Science Alumni Network
description: Ongoing mentorship and networking opportunities for past competition participants, providing career guidance, research connections, and continued STEM community involvement.

name: IXL Math - Kindergarten
description: Comprehensive kindergarten math curriculum with 200+ skills. Counting to 20, number recognition, basic addition and subtraction, shapes, patterns, measurement, and comparison. Adaptive practice with instant feedback.

name: IXL Math - 1st Grade
description: First grade math with 300+ skills. Addition and subtraction within 20, place value, time, money, measurement, data and graphs, and geometry. Standards-aligned adaptive learning.

name: IXL Math - 2nd Grade
description: Second grade math covering 400+ skills. Addition and subtraction within 100, place value to 1000, multiplication foundations, fractions, measurement, time, money, and data analysis.

name: IXL Math - 3rd Grade
description: Third grade math with 500+ skills. Multiplication and division, fractions, area and perimeter, time, measurement, data, and problem-solving. Interactive practice with real-world applications.

name: IXL Math - 4th Grade
description: Fourth grade math covering 600+ skills. Multi-digit multiplication and division, fractions and decimals, measurement conversions, geometry, and data interpretation. Comprehensive skill building.

name: IXL Math - 5th Grade
description: Fifth grade math with 700+ skills. Decimal operations, fraction operations, volume, coordinate planes, and algebraic thinking. Prepare for middle school mathematics.

name: IXL Math - 6th Grade
description: Sixth grade math covering 800+ skills. Ratios, rates, percentages, negative numbers, algebraic expressions, equations, area, surface area, and statistics. Middle school mathematics foundation.

name: IXL Math - 7th Grade
description: Seventh grade math with 900+ skills. Proportional relationships, rational numbers, linear equations, geometric constructions, probability, and statistics. Advanced middle school topics.

name: IXL Math - 8th Grade
description: Eighth grade math covering 1000+ skills. Linear functions, systems of equations, transformations, Pythagorean theorem, exponents, and scientific notation. Algebra 1 preparation.

name: IXL Math - Algebra 1
description: Complete Algebra 1 curriculum with 1000+ skills. Linear equations, inequalities, systems, quadratic functions, polynomials, factoring, and exponential functions. High school mathematics foundation.

name: IXL Math - Geometry
description: Comprehensive geometry curriculum with 900+ skills. Proofs, transformations, congruence, similarity, trigonometry, circles, and coordinate geometry. Visual and interactive practice.

name: IXL Math - Algebra 2
description: Advanced algebra with 1100+ skills. Polynomials, rational expressions, logarithms, sequences, series, conic sections, and complex numbers. College preparatory mathematics.

name: IXL Math - Precalculus
description: Precalculus curriculum with 800+ skills. Advanced functions, trigonometry, vectors, matrices, parametric equations, and polar coordinates. Preparation for calculus.

name: IXL Math - Calculus
description: Calculus curriculum covering limits, derivatives, integrals, and applications. AP Calculus AB/BC aligned content with comprehensive practice problems.

name: IXL Science - 2nd Grade
description: Elementary science curriculum with 150+ skills. Plants and animals, habitats, matter, forces, energy, weather, and scientific inquiry. Interactive diagrams and real-world scenarios.

name: IXL Science - 3rd Grade
description: Third grade science with 200+ skills. Life cycles, ecosystems, properties of matter, forces and motion, weather patterns, and engineering design. NGSS-aligned curriculum.

name: IXL Science - 4th Grade
description: Fourth grade science covering 250+ skills. Energy transfer, waves, structures of life, Earth systems, natural resources, and technology. Interactive science simulations.
stem_fields: Science, Physics, Biology, Earth Science, Technology

name: IXL Science - 5th Grade
description: Fifth grade science with 300+ skills. Matter and energy, ecosystems, Earth systems, space systems, and engineering solutions. Comprehensive elementary science conclusion.
stem_fields: Science, Physics, Biology, Earth Science, Space Science

name: IXL Science - 6th Grade
description: Sixth grade science covering 350+ skills. Cell structure, genetics, plate tectonics, energy resources, thermal energy, and scientific investigation. Middle school science foundation.
stem_fields: Science, Biology, Earth Science, Physics, Genetics

name: IXL Science - 7th Grade
description: Seventh grade science with 400+ skills. Chemical reactions, force and motion, waves, evolution, biodiversity, Earth history, and climate. Advanced middle school topics.
stem_fields: Science, Chemistry, Physics, Biology, Earth Science

name: IXL Science - 8th Grade
description: Eighth grade science covering 450+ skills. Atomic structure, periodic table, motion and forces, energy, reproduction, inheritance, and astronomy. High school science preparation.

name: IXL Science - Biology
description: High school biology curriculum with 500+ skills. Cell biology, genetics, evolution, ecology, human body systems, and scientific practices. Comprehensive life science course.

name: IXL Science - Chemistry
description: High school chemistry with 450+ skills. Atomic theory, chemical bonding, stoichiometry, thermodynamics, kinetics, equilibrium, and acid-base chemistry. College preparatory chemistry.

name: IXL Science - Physics
description: High school physics covering 400+ skills. Mechanics, energy, waves, electricity, magnetism, and modern physics. Mathematical problem-solving and conceptual understanding.

name: IXL Science - Earth Science
description: High school Earth science with 350+ skills. Geology, meteorology, oceanography, astronomy, and environmental science. Study Earth systems and space.

name: IXL Social Studies - Elementary (K-5)
description: Elementary social studies covering geography, history, civics, and culture. Map skills, historical events, community, and citizenship concepts. Interactive content for young learners.

name: IXL Language Arts - Reading Comprehension (All Grades)
description: Comprehensive reading comprehension across K-12. Literary analysis, informational texts, vocabulary development, and critical reading skills. Adaptive leveled passages.

name: IXL Spanish - Elementary to High School
description: Spanish language learning across all levels. Vocabulary, grammar, verb conjugations, reading comprehension, and cultural understanding. Interactive language practice.

name: IXL Analytics - Student Progress Tracking
description: Comprehensive analytics dashboard tracking student progress, skill mastery, time spent, and areas needing improvement. Real-time insights for parents and teachers. Included with subscription.

name: IXL Diagnostic - Adaptive Assessment
description: Adaptive diagnostic assessment identifying student knowledge gaps and strengths across subjects. Creates personalized learning paths based on assessment results. Continuous diagnostic throughout learning.

name: IXL Awards and Certificates
description: Motivation system with awards, certificates, and achievement tracking. Students earn awards for skill mastery, practice time, and continuous learning. Gamification elements to encourage engagement.

name: Jack Kent Cooke Young Scholars Program
description: Comprehensive five-year pre-college scholarship for exceptional middle school students with financial need. Provides academic advising, summer programs, internships, and up to $40,000 per year for high school. Serves students in 7th or 8th grade.

name: MATHCOUNTS School Competition
description: Starting level of MATHCOUNTS competition series administered by coaches at individual schools. Students compete in Sprint, Target, and Team rounds to qualify for Chapter competition.

name: MATHCOUNTS Chapter Competition
description: Local competition where schools compete with up to 14 students (4 team members plus 10 individual competitors). Includes Sprint, Target, Team, and Countdown rounds.

name: MATHCOUNTS State Competition
description: State-level competition for top performers from Chapter competitions. Features all four rounds: Sprint, Target, Team, and Countdown with increasing difficulty.

name: MATHCOUNTS National Competition
description: Premier national mathematics competition for middle school students. Top 4 individuals from each state compete in all-expenses-paid event with Sprint, Target, Team, and Countdown rounds.

name: MATHCOUNTS Sprint Round
description: Timed 40-minute round with 30 problems testing speed and accuracy. No calculators permitted. Designed to challenge quick mathematical computation skills.

name: MATHCOUNTS Target Round
description: Problem-solving round with 8 multi-step problems in 4 sets, 6 minutes per set. Calculator use permitted. Tests mathematical reasoning and problem-solving processes.

name: MATHCOUNTS Team Round
description: Collaborative round where 4-member teams work together to solve 10 problems in 20 minutes. Calculator use permitted. Encourages teamwork and mathematical collaboration.

name: MATHCOUNTS Countdown Round
description: Fast-paced oral competition for top individual scorers. Head-to-head matches with 45 seconds per problem, no calculators. Most exciting round with audience participation.

name: MATHCOUNTS Math Video Challenge
description: Annual video competition where students create math-focused videos. Students explore real-world applications of mathematics while developing creativity and communication skills.

name: MATHCOUNTS Club Program
description: Year-round program providing resources for schools to start math clubs. Includes practice problems, coaching materials, and preparation for competitions.

name: MATHCOUNTS Problem of the Week
description: Weekly online math problems for continuous practice and skill development. Provides regular challenge problems with solutions to keep students engaged year-round.

name: HelloPurr - First App Tutorial
description: Create your first mobile app with MIT App Inventor by building HelloPurr, a simple app that displays an image and plays a sound when touched. Learn basic app components and event handling.

name: TalkToMe - Text-to-Speech App
description: Build an app that converts typed text into spoken words using text-to-speech functionality. Learn about user interface design, text input components, and device capabilities.

name: PaintPot - Drawing App
description: Create a digital painting app where users can draw on the screen using different colors and tools. Introduction to canvas components, touch events, and graphics programming.

name: BallBounce - Animation and Games
description: Build an interactive ball bouncing game with collision detection and score keeping. Learn animation, sprite components, collision detection, and game logic programming.

name: MoleMash - Touch and Timer Game
description: Create a whack-a-mole style game with moving targets, timers, and scoring. Learn about random positioning, timer components, and game state management.

name: Xylophone - Music and Sound App
description: Build a virtual xylophone that plays musical notes when keys are touched. Explore sound components, multiple audio files, and creating interactive musical interfaces.

name: AndroidMash - Accelerometer Game
description: Create an advanced game using device sensors like the accelerometer to control game objects. Learn sensor programming, physics simulation, and advanced game mechanics.

name: MapIt - GPS and Mapping App
description: Build an app that uses GPS location services and displays maps with markers. Learn about location sensors, web APIs, and integrating external mapping services.

name: Hour of Code - Pet Selfie App
description: One-hour coding activity where students create a pet photo app with customizable features. Perfect introduction to mobile app development and visual programming concepts.

name: Hour of Code - Logo Turtle Graphics
description: Create geometric art and patterns using turtle graphics programming. Introduction to computational thinking through visual programming and mathematical concepts.

name: Creative Computing with MIT App Inventor
description: Extended curriculum unit combining computer science concepts with creative expression through mobile app development. Includes multiple projects and assessment rubrics.

name: Mystery Science - Kindergarten: Animal Superpowers
description: Explore how animals use special features to survive. Video lessons on animal adaptations, camouflage, and defense mechanisms. Hands-on activities observing and comparing animal traits. 30-45 minute lessons with minimal materials.
stem_fields: Life Science, Biology, Zoology, Animal Adaptations

name: Mystery Science - Kindergarten: Sunlight and Weather
description: Investigate how sunlight affects Earth and weather patterns. Video-based exploration of day/night, seasons, and temperature. Simple outdoor observations and data collection. NGSS-aligned earth science for early learners.

name: Mystery Science - Kindergarten: Pushes and Pulls
description: Explore forces through hands-on activities. Test how pushes and pulls affect motion using everyday objects. Video demonstrations of force concepts. Build understanding of physics through play-based learning.

name: Mystery Science - 1st Grade: Light and Sound
description: Investigate how light travels and sounds are made. Hands-on exploration of shadows, reflection, vibration, and volume. Video lessons demonstrating wave properties. Simple experiments with flashlights and musical instruments.
stem_fields: Physics, Light, Sound, Waves, Physical Science

name: Mystery Science - 1st Grade: Plant and Animal Relationships
description: Explore how plants and animals depend on each other. Study pollination, seed dispersal, and food chains. Video-based investigation of ecosystems. Outdoor observations of local plants and animals.

name: Mystery Science - 1st Grade: Moon, Sun, and Stars
description: Observe patterns in the sky. Track moon phases, explore why we have day and night, and identify star patterns. Video lessons on space science. Simple observation journals and sky watching activities.
stem_fields: Astronomy, Space Science, Earth Science, Patterns

name: Mystery Science - 2nd Grade: Properties of Matter
description: Investigate materials and their properties. Test solid, liquid, and gas states. Explore heating, cooling, and reversible changes. Video demonstrations of matter transformations with hands-on experiments.

name: Mystery Science - 2nd Grade: Plant Life Cycles
description: Study how plants grow and reproduce. Plant seeds, observe germination, and track growth stages. Video lessons on pollination and seed formation. Document plant life cycles through drawings and journals.
stem_fields: Life Science, Botany, Biology, Plant Science

name: Mystery Science - 2nd Grade: Earth's Land and Water
description: Explore Earth's diverse landscapes and water features. Study mountains, valleys, rivers, and oceans. Map local landforms and water sources. Video tours of geological formations and erosion processes.

name: Mystery Science - 3rd Grade: Weather and Climate
description: Investigate weather patterns and climate zones. Track temperature, precipitation, and wind over time. Video lessons on meteorology and climate science. Build weather instruments and analyze data.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Meteorology, Climate Science, Data Analysis

name: Mystery Science - 3rd Grade: Forces and Interactions
description: Explore balanced and unbalanced forces. Investigate friction, magnetism, and gravity through experiments. Video demonstrations of force concepts. Design solutions using force principles.

name: Mystery Science - 3rd Grade: Traits and Inheritance
description: Study how organisms inherit traits from parents. Observe variation in species and family resemblances. Video lessons on genetics basics. Create family tree diagrams showing inherited characteristics.

name: Mystery Science - 3rd Grade: Fossils and Ancient Life
description: Discover how fossils form and what they reveal about ancient organisms. Create fossil models and study geological time. Video explorations of paleontology. Learn how scientists reconstruct ancient environments.

name: Mystery Science - 4th Grade: Energy Transfer
description: Investigate how energy moves and changes form. Explore kinetic and potential energy, heat transfer, and electrical circuits. Video lessons on energy concepts. Build simple machines and circuits.

name: Mystery Science - 4th Grade: Waves and Information
description: Study how waves transmit information. Explore light waves, sound waves, and digital communication. Video demonstrations of wave properties. Design devices that use waves to send signals.

name: Mystery Science - 4th Grade: Weathering and Erosion
description: Investigate how Earth's surface changes over time. Model erosion processes using wind, water, and ice. Video lessons on geological changes. Map erosion patterns in local environment.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Geology, Erosion, Environmental Science

name: Mystery Science - 4th Grade: Animal Senses and Communication
description: Explore how animals use senses to survive and communicate. Study echolocation, pheromones, and visual signals. Video lessons on animal behavior. Compare human and animal sensory systems.
stem_fields: Life Science, Zoology, Animal Behavior, Biology

name: Mystery Science - 5th Grade: Matter and Energy in Ecosystems
description: Study how matter and energy flow through food webs. Investigate photosynthesis, decomposition, and nutrient cycling. Video lessons on ecosystem dynamics. Create food web models.
stem_fields: Life Science, Ecology, Energy Flow, Ecosystems

name: Mystery Science - 5th Grade: Earth's Systems
description: Explore interactions between geosphere, hydrosphere, atmosphere, and biosphere. Study water cycle, rock cycle, and climate systems. Video lessons on Earth system science. Model system interactions.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Systems Thinking, Environmental Science, Geology

name: Mystery Science - 5th Grade: Space Systems
description: Study Earth, Moon, and Sun interactions. Investigate seasons, eclipses, and tides. Video tours of solar system. Build scale models demonstrating orbital mechanics and astronomical phenomena.
stem_fields: Astronomy, Space Science, Physics, Earth Science

name: Mystery Science - 5th Grade: Structure and Properties of Matter
description: Investigate particle theory and chemical changes. Test physical vs chemical changes, mixtures vs solutions. Video demonstrations of molecular behavior. Conduct experiments measuring mass and volume.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Matter, Physical Science, Molecular Science

name: Mystery Science - Mini-Lesson: Why Do Leaves Change Color?
description: Quick 15-minute lesson on autumn leaf color change. Video explaining chlorophyll breakdown and pigment reveal. Perfect for seasonal science or filling class time. Minimal materials needed.
stem_fields: Life Science, Botany, Chemistry, Plant Science

name: Mystery Science - Mini-Lesson: How Do Airplanes Fly?
description: Brief exploration of flight and aerodynamics. Video demonstrating lift, drag, thrust, and weight. Simple paper airplane activity. 15-minute engaging introduction to physics.

name: Mystery Science - Mini-Lesson: Why Is the Ocean Salty?
description: Quick lesson on ocean salinity and the water cycle. Video explaining mineral dissolution and evaporation. 15-minute exploration of earth science concepts. Accessible for multiple grade levels.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Oceanography, Chemistry, Water Science

name: Mystery Science - Mini-Lesson: How Do Chameleons Change Color?
description: Fast-paced lesson on animal adaptations and camouflage. Video revealing chromatophore cells and color-changing mechanisms. 15-minute engaging biology content for elementary students.
stem_fields: Life Science, Biology, Zoology, Animal Adaptations

name: Mystery Science - Home Learning Edition
description: Free access to video lessons for home learning. Parents guide children through science lessons at home. Same high-quality content adapted for family use. Minimal materials using household items.

name: Mystery Science - Engineering Design Challenges
description: Cross-grade engineering projects solving real-world problems. Design, test, and improve solutions using engineering design process. Video guidance and material lists. Adaptable for grades K-5.
stem_fields: Engineering, Design Thinking, Problem Solving, STEM

name: Mystery Science - Scientific Method Practice
description: Lessons teaching inquiry skills across topics. Ask questions, make predictions, test hypotheses, analyze data, and draw conclusions. Video modeling scientific thinking. Adaptable experiments for all elementary grades.
stem_fields: Scientific Method, Inquiry, Critical Thinking, Research Skills

name: Mystery Science - Spanish Language Lessons
description: Select lessons available in Spanish for dual-language classrooms and Spanish-speaking families. Video content with Spanish narration. Support bilingual science education and English language learners.
stem_fields: Multi-Subject Science, Bilingual Education, Language Support

name: Mystery Science - Free School Program
description: Free full access for Title I schools and high-need districts. Complete K-5 science curriculum at no cost to qualifying schools. Application process for schools serving low-income communities. Equity-focused distribution.
stem_fields: Multi-Subject Science, Educational Equity, Title I Support

name: Virtual Guest Program
description: Since 2020, NASA has invited you, the public, to be virtual guests at launches and milestone events. As a virtual guest, you have access to curated resources, schedule changes, and mission specific information delivered straight to your inbox. Following each activity, guests are sent a stamp for their virtual guest passport! All resources, participation, and registration are FREE. Select your opportunities. Join us!

name: NASA Internship Programs
description: At NASA, we explore the extraordinary every day and our work is more than just a professionits a lifelong pursuit and a passion. NASA offers students challenging projects and on-the-job experiences, building confidence, essential technical skills, and career readiness, all essential for the nations workforce. NASAs Office of STEM Engagement provides, annually, more than 2,000 students the opportunity to impact the agencys mission through a hands-on internship.

name: NASA Student Launch Challenge
description: Design, build, test, and launch high-powered rockets for NASA Student Launch challenge. Middle and high school teams compete in engineering design aligned with NASA research.

name: NASA TechRise Student Challenge
description: Develop science or technology experiment ideas for NASA TechRise flight vehicles. Teams design experiments that fly on suborbital flights or high-altitude balloons.

name: Human Exploration Rover Challenge (HERC)
description: Engineer and test human-powered vehicles designed for otherworldly surfaces. Teams navigate obstacle courses and complete mission tasks with NASA engineers.

name: NASA App Development Challenge
description: Coding challenge where NASA presents technical problems to high school students seeking contributions to deep space exploration missions.

name: NASA USRP High School Internships
description: Hands-on STEM internships at NASA centers for high school students. Work with NASA scientists and engineers on authentic research projects.
stem_fields: Aerospace Engineering, Earth Science, Space Science

name: Artemis Student Challenges
description: Design solutions for lunar exploration challenges aligned with NASA Artemis missions. Students tackle real problems for Moon exploration.

name: NASA GLOBE Student Research
description: Conduct environmental observations and research projects connected to NASA Earth science missions. Collect real scientific data for NASA research.

name: NASA Aviation Design Challenge
description: Dream of creative innovations for the future of aviation. Solve real-world issues NASA Aeronautics is working on for safer, sustainable flight.

name: Mars Student Challenge
description: Design technologies and solutions for Mars exploration missions. Students work on authentic challenges facing NASA Mars exploration.

name: NASA Student Ambassador Program
description: Students serve as ambassadors sharing NASA STEM content with peers and community. Gain leadership experience while promoting space exploration.

name: Power to Explore STEM Writing Challenge
description: National writing competition about radioisotope power systems for space exploration. Plan missions using Radioisotope Power Systems to explore moons.

name: NASA Student Independent Research
description: Conduct independent research projects mentored by NASA scientists. High school students work on cutting-edge space and Earth science research.

name: Galpagos Islands Student Expedition
description: Explore the living laboratory of evolution where Darwin developed his theory. Students study endemic species, marine ecosystems, and conservation efforts while snorkeling with sea lions and observing giant tortoises.

name: Costa Rica Wildlife Conservation Expedition
description: Immerse in tropical biodiversity while contributing to sea turtle conservation efforts. Students conduct field research, assist with wildlife monitoring, and learn about rainforest ecology.

name: Peru Archaeological Discovery Expedition
description: Explore ancient Incan civilization through hands-on archaeological work and cultural immersion. Students learn excavation techniques, artifact analysis, and Andean cultural traditions.

name: Iceland Geology and Climate Expedition
description: Study volcanic activity, glacial processes, and climate change effects in Iceland. Students examine geothermal features, ice caves, and learn about renewable energy solutions.

name: Borneo Rainforest Conservation Expedition
description: Experience tropical rainforest biodiversity while contributing to orangutan conservation efforts. Students conduct primate research, learn about deforestation impacts, and engage with local communities.

name: Yellowstone Wildlife Ecology Expedition
description: Study North American wildlife ecosystems and conservation efforts in America's first national park. Students track wolves, observe bison herds, and learn about ecosystem restoration.

name: Alaska Marine Science Expedition
description: Explore marine ecosystems of Southeast Alaska while studying whales, glaciers, and coastal ecology. Students participate in whale research and learn about climate change impacts on Arctic systems.
stem_fields: Marine Science, Environmental Science, Climate Science

name: Grand Canyon Geology Expedition
description: Study geological processes and deep time through hands-on exploration of the Grand Canyon. Students learn rock identification, geological mapping, and Colorado River ecology.

name: Monterey Bay Marine Discovery Program
description: Introduction to marine science through exploration of Monterey Bay's diverse marine ecosystem. Middle school students study kelp forests, marine mammals, and ocean conservation.

name: Washington DC Science and Exploration Program
description: Explore science museums, research institutions, and National Geographic headquarters. Middle school students engage with scientists, visit labs, and learn about careers in exploration.

name: National Geographic Photography Workshop
description: Learn visual storytelling techniques from National Geographic photographers while exploring natural landscapes. Students develop technical photography skills and environmental awareness.

name: Digital Storytelling and Conservation Expedition
description: Combine multimedia storytelling with conservation science to create compelling narratives about environmental issues. Students use video, photography, and digital media tools.

name: Paleontology Field Research Expedition
description: Participate in authentic paleontological research through fossil excavation and analysis. Students learn scientific research methods while contributing to ongoing paleontological discoveries.

name: National Merit Scholarship Program
description: Premier academic competition for high school students based on PSAT/NMSQT scores. Recognizes students with exceptional academic ability and potential for success in college. Provides scholarships up to $2,500 and corporate/college-sponsored awards.

name: National Merit Semifinalist Program
description: Top 1% of PSAT/NMSQT test takers nationwide advance to Semifinalist status. Students must complete detailed scholarship application including academic record, extracurricular activities, leadership, and essay.

name: National Merit Finalist Recognition
description: Approximately 15,000 Semifinalists advance to Finalist standing based on academic record, school recommendation, SAT scores confirming PSAT performance, and essay. About 7,500 Finalists receive Merit Scholarship awards.

name: College-Sponsored Merit Scholarships
description: Colleges and universities sponsor scholarships for National Merit Finalists who will attend their institution. Awards range from partial tuition to full rides, often including additional benefits.

name: National Achievement Scholarship Program
description: Academic competition specifically for outstanding Black American high school students. Recognizes academic promise and provides scholarships for college education. Based on PSAT/NMSQT scores and academic achievement.

name: National Hispanic Recognition Program (PSAT/NMSQT)
description: Recognition program for outstanding Hispanic/Latino high school students based on PSAT/NMSQT performance. Provides academic recognition that can lead to college recruitment and scholarship opportunities.

name: NIH Summer Internship Program (SIP)
description: Competitive 8-10 week summer research internship for high school and college students to conduct biomedical research alongside NIH scientists. Students work in laboratories across all NIH institutes and centers.

name: NIH High School Scientific Training Program
description: Intensive research training program for academically talented high school students. Participants conduct independent research projects under mentorship of NIH scientists.

name: National Institute of Mental Health Research Training
description: Research training opportunities in mental health and neuroscience for high school and undergraduate students. Focus on brain research and behavioral sciences.

name: National Cancer Institute Student Training Program
description: Summer research program focusing on cancer research and oncology. Students work with leading cancer researchers on cutting-edge projects.

name: National Human Genome Research Institute Training
description: Genomics and bioinformatics research training for students interested in human genetics and computational biology.

name: Training Opportunities
description: NIH research training program for students

name: NOAA Student Internship Program
description: Summer internship opportunities for high school and college students to work with NOAA scientists on research projects in ocean, climate, weather, and environmental science fields.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ocean Science, Climate Science

name: NOAA Ocean Service Educational Resources
description: Ocean and coastal science educational materials, virtual labs, and interactive tools for students to explore marine ecosystems, ocean exploration, and coastal processes.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ocean Science, Marine Biology

name: National Weather Service Education Resources
description: Weather and meteorology education programs including storm spotting, weather safety, and atmospheric science concepts for students and communities.

name: NOAA Student Research Partnership
description: Collaborative research opportunities for high school students to work on authentic NOAA research projects with scientist mentors, focusing on environmental and climate science.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Climate Science, Ocean Science

name: NOAA Ocean Exploration Student Video Challenge
description: Annual video competition where students create educational videos about ocean exploration, marine life, or ocean conservation to promote ocean literacy and awareness.

name: NOAA Ocean Guardian School Program
description: Recognition program for schools implementing ocean conservation projects and marine stewardship activities, providing resources and curriculum support.

name: NOAA Virtual Ocean Exploration
description: Live and archived virtual ocean exploration experiences where students can participate in real-time deep-sea discoveries with NOAA Ocean Exploration scientists.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ocean Science, Marine Biology

name: NOAA Climate Explorer
description: Interactive online tool and educational program for students to explore climate data, create visualizations, and understand climate patterns and trends.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Climate Science, Data Science

name: NOAA Educational Partnership Program Scholarships
description: Scholarship opportunities for underrepresented students pursuing careers in NOAA mission areas including ocean, atmospheric, and environmental sciences.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ocean Science, Atmospheric Science

name: NOAA Marine Debris Monitoring Programs
description: Citizen science programs where students and communities monitor and collect data on marine debris to support NOAA research and conservation efforts.

name: NOAA Weather Observer Programs
description: Citizen science weather monitoring programs where students learn meteorological observation techniques and contribute data to national weather databases.

name: NOAA Science Fair Project Support
description: Resources, data access, and mentorship opportunities for students conducting science fair projects related to NOAA mission areas in environmental and ocean sciences.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ocean Science, Climate Science

name: NSBE Jr. - National Membership Program
description: National Society of Black Engineers Junior membership program for Black K-12 students interested in STEM careers. Access to local chapter meetings, workshops, and competitions. Networking with Black engineers and STEM professionals. College preparation resources and mentorship. Leadership development through chapter officer positions. Annual membership provides year-round programming and support. Focus on building pipeline of Black engineers. Access to national conferences and regional events.
stem_fields: Engineering, Computer Science, Technology, Mathematics, Science

name: NSBE Jr. - Try-Engineering Competition
description: National engineering design competition for NSBE Jr. members in grades 6-12. Teams design and build solutions to real-world engineering challenges. Categories for middle school and high school divisions. Projects judged on creativity, technical execution, and presentation. Winners receive scholarships and recognition at national conference. Emphasis on teamwork and engineering design process. Mentorship from chapter advisors and professional engineers. Virtual submission with potential in-person finals.

name: NSBE Jr. - Torch Awards Competition
description: Academic excellence and leadership competition for NSBE Jr. members. Students submit portfolios demonstrating STEM achievement, community service, and leadership. Categories for elementary, middle, and high school. Winners receive scholarships and recognition at national convention. Emphasis on well-rounded excellence. Includes essay, transcript, and recommendation letters. Preparation for college applications. National and regional awards.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Leadership, Academic Excellence

name: NSBE Jr. - Annual National Convention Youth Track
description: Multi-day youth track at NSBE National Convention for K-12 members. Engineering workshops, college fair, career expo, and competitions. Meet Black engineers from Fortune 500 companies. Hands-on STEM activities and team challenges. Leadership development and college preparation sessions. Networking with thousands of Black STEM professionals. Awards ceremonies and scholarship announcements. Typically held in March. Registration includes convention access and materials.

name: NSBE Jr. - Regional Leadership Conferences
description: Regional conferences held throughout the year in NSBE regions. Leadership training, STEM workshops, and team building activities. More affordable and accessible than national convention. Opportunity to meet students from nearby chapters. Engineering challenges and academic competitions. College representatives and career panels. Typically one-day or weekend events. Lower cost alternative to national programming.

name: NSBE Jr. - Local Chapter Meetings
description: Weekly or monthly chapter meetings at schools or community centers. STEM activities, guest speakers, and college preparation. Homework help and tutoring from high school and college mentors. Field trips to engineering companies and universities. Community service projects applying STEM skills. Leadership opportunities through chapter officer positions. Family-friendly environment welcoming parents. Free or low-cost for members.

name: NSBE Jr. - Summer Engineering Experience for Kids (SEEK)
description: Week-long day camp introducing elementary students to engineering. Hands-on projects in different engineering disciplines each day. Build bridges, circuits, robots, and simple machines. Field trips to engineering sites. Age-appropriate activities for grades K-5. Lunch and materials provided. Held at university campuses and community centers. Emphasis on making engineering fun and accessible. Limited financial aid available.

name: NSBE Jr. - College Tours Program
description: Organized visits to Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) and other top engineering schools. Meet Black engineering students and faculty. Tour campus facilities, labs, and residence halls. Learn about admissions, scholarships, and financial aid. Understand college life and academic expectations. Typically for middle and high school students. May include overnight stays. Build excitement about college STEM pathways.
stem_fields: College Preparation, Career Exploration, Engineering Education

name: NSBE Jr. - Mentorship Circles
description: Structured mentorship pairing NSBE Jr. members with college students and professional engineers. Monthly virtual or in-person meetings. Academic guidance, career advice, and personal development. Help with college applications and scholarship essays. Exposure to different engineering careers. Long-term relationships building over years. Focus on Black engineering role models. Support navigating challenges as Black student in STEM.

name: NSBE Jr. - Parent and Family Engagement
description: Programming designed to engage parents in supporting their children STEM education. Workshops on college planning, financial aid, and scholarship applications. Information sessions about engineering careers and pathways. Networking opportunities with other Black STEM families. Resources for advocating for children in schools. Family STEM nights and social events. Recognition that family support is critical to student success.

name: NSBE Jr. - Academic Excellence Workshops
description: Workshops focusing on study skills, time management, and academic success strategies. Test preparation for SAT, ACT, and AP exams. Math and science tutoring sessions. Writing workshops for essays and research papers. Learning strategies specific to STEM subjects. Building confidence in academic abilities. Peer study groups and accountability partners. Free for members.
stem_fields: Academic Skills, Test Preparation, Tutoring, Study Skills

name: NSBE Jr. - Corporate Partner Internships and Shadowing
description: Summer internship and job shadowing opportunities with corporate partners like Boeing, Lockheed Martin, and Microsoft. High school students get real-world engineering experience. Week-long or summer-long placements. Paid internships when possible. Learn about different engineering roles and industries. Build professional skills and resume. Networking with corporate engineers. Preference given to active NSBE Jr. members.

name: NSBE Jr. - Online Learning Platform
description: Digital platform with STEM learning resources, video tutorials, and online workshops. Self-paced courses in engineering fundamentals, coding, and mathematics. Webinars with Black engineers and STEM professionals. Virtual study halls and homework help. Competition resources and submission portals. 24/7 access to educational content. Supplementing local chapter programming. Especially valuable for students without local chapters.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Online Learning, Self-Paced Education

name: NSBE Jr. - Scholarship and Financial Aid Workshops
description: Workshops helping students and families navigate college funding. Information on NSBE scholarships, STEM scholarships, and general financial aid. Help completing FAFSA and scholarship applications. Essay writing workshops for scholarship applications. Connecting students with scholarship opportunities. Understanding costs of different colleges. Financial literacy for college students. Critical support for families new to college process.
stem_fields: College Preparation, Financial Literacy, Scholarship Applications

name: Osmo - Tangram
description: Classic tangram puzzle game with physical pieces and digital feedback. Arrange geometric shapes to match on-screen puzzles. Develops spatial reasoning, problem-solving, and geometric thinking through 500+ puzzles with progressive difficulty.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Geometry, Spatial Reasoning, Problem Solving

name: Osmo - Numbers
description: Hands-on math game using physical number tiles and on-screen challenges. Build number sense, addition, subtraction, and counting through interactive gameplay. Features multiple difficulty levels adapting to ages 5-10 with over 50 games.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Arithmetic, Number Sense, Problem Solving

name: Osmo - Words
description: Spelling and vocabulary game with letter tiles. Guess words based on visual clues and place physical letters to spell answers. Builds literacy, vocabulary, and spelling skills for ages 5-12 with hundreds of word challenges.

name: Osmo - Coding Awbie
description: Introduction to coding using physical coding blocks. Guide Awbie character through adventures by arranging command blocks. Teaches sequencing, loops, and problem-solving to ages 5-10 through 60+ coding puzzles.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Computational Thinking, Logic

name: Osmo - Coding Jam
description: Advanced coding game creating musical compositions. Use coding blocks to program beats, melodies, and harmonies. Combines programming fundamentals with music theory for ages 5-12. Develop computational thinking while making music.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Music, Audio Engineering

name: Osmo - Coding Duo
description: Cooperative coding game for two players using physical blocks. Solve coding challenges together teaching teamwork, communication, and programming logic. Ages 5-10 develop collaborative problem-solving through 60+ puzzles.

name: Osmo - Pizza Co.
description: Math and entrepreneurship game running virtual pizza business. Calculate change, manage toppings, and handle orders using physical coins and bills. Ages 5-12 develop money math, fractions, and business skills through gameplay.

name: Osmo - Masterpiece
description: Digital drawing and art game with physical drawing. Transform photos into line drawings and trace with real paper and markers. Develop artistic skills, visual perception, and fine motor control for ages 5-12.
stem_fields: Art, Design, Visual Arts, Fine Motor Skills

name: Osmo - Monster
description: Creative drawing game bringing drawings to life. Draw characters, objects, and scenery with physical materials while digital monster interacts. Ages 3-8 develop creativity, imagination, and artistic expression.

name: Osmo - Newton
description: Physics puzzle game using real-world objects. Guide falling balls to targets by placing physical items like pencils, toys, or hands. Ages 5-12 learn physics concepts, cause-and-effect, and creative problem-solving through 60+ levels.

name: Osmo - Detective Agency
description: Geography and world knowledge game solving mysteries globally. Use physical magnifying glass to find clues and travel the world solving cases. Ages 5-12 develop geography, cultural awareness, and deductive reasoning through 60+ mysteries.
stem_fields: Geography, World Cultures, Critical Thinking, Research

name: Osmo - Squiggle Magic
description: Early learning game for preschoolers combining drawing and letter recognition. Draw squiggles that transform into animated characters teaching letters, shapes, and creativity. Ages 3-5 develop pre-literacy and fine motor skills.
stem_fields: Pre-Literacy, Letters, Shapes, Fine Motor Skills

name: Osmo - ABCs
description: Alphabet learning game with physical letter tiles. Match uppercase and lowercase letters, learn letter sounds, and build early literacy. Ages 3-6 develop phonics awareness and letter recognition through interactive play.

name: Osmo - Stories
description: Storytelling and reading comprehension game with physical costume pieces. Dress characters and create interactive stories developing literacy and creativity. Ages 4-7 build narrative skills and reading comprehension.

name: Osmo - Costume Party
description: Pattern recognition and matching game with costume pieces. Dress on-screen characters by matching physical costume accessories. Ages 3-5 develop visual discrimination, matching skills, and social-emotional learning.
stem_fields: Pattern Recognition, Visual Discrimination, Matching, Social Skills

name: Osmo - Creative Starter Kit
description: Bundle including Tangram, Numbers, and Words games with Osmo Base. Complete starter package for ages 5-12 covering math, geometry, and literacy. Foundation for hands-on digital learning with three core educational games.

name: Osmo - Coding Starter Kit
description: Bundle with Coding Awbie, Coding Jam, and Coding Duo plus Osmo Base. Comprehensive introduction to programming for ages 5-12 using physical coding blocks. Three games teaching sequencing, loops, and computational thinking.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Computational Thinking, Logic

name: Osmo - Little Genius Starter Kit
description: Early learning bundle for ages 3-5 with ABCs, Squiggle Magic, Costume Party, and Stories. Comprehensive preschool curriculum covering letters, shapes, creativity, and social-emotional skills through hands-on play.

name: Osmo - Genius Starter Kit
description: Complete learning bundle with five core games: Tangram, Numbers, Words, Newton, and Masterpiece plus Osmo Base. Ages 6-12 comprehensive STEM and creativity education covering math, literacy, physics, and art.

name: Osmo - Math Wizard Series
description: Advanced math game series teaching addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division through magical adventures. Physical number and operation tiles solve puzzles and defeat dragons. Ages 6-10 build computational fluency.

name: Osmo - Multi-Language Support
description: Games available in 20+ languages including Spanish, French, German, Japanese, and Chinese. Language-agnostic games like Tangram and Newton work universally. Supports English language learners and international families.

name: Osmo - Screen Time Alternative
description: Physical hands-on learning reducing passive screen time. Children manipulate real objects while receiving digital feedback. Promotes active learning, motor skills, and healthy tech habits for ages 3-12.
stem_fields: Hands-On Learning, Active Learning, Healthy Technology Use

name: Osmo - Special Education Support
description: Games designed for children with diverse learning needs including visual, tactile, and kinesthetic learners. Physical manipulation supports fine motor development and multisensory learning. Used in special education classrooms.
stem_fields: Special Education, Accessibility, Inclusive Design, Multi-Sensory

name: PBS Kids - Curious George: Rocket Run
description: Build and launch rockets with Curious George. Learn physics concepts including thrust, weight, and trajectory. Design rockets by selecting fuel types and nose cones. Ages 4-7 experiment with trial and error to reach space.

name: PBS Kids - Sid the Science Kid: Bug Garden
description: Explore life science and ecology with Sid. Plant seeds, water gardens, and observe insect life cycles. Learn about plant growth, pollination, and ecosystems. Ages 3-6 develop observation and classification skills.

name: PBS Kids - Cyberchase: Thirteen Ways of Looking at a Half
description: Explore fractions and equivalence with Cyberchase characters. Divide shapes and quantities to understand halves, quarters, and equal parts. Ages 6-8 develop fraction sense and spatial reasoning through interactive puzzles.

name: PBS Kids - Wild Kratts: Creature Power
description: Learn animal biology and adaptations with Wild Kratts brothers. Activate creature powers to explore animal abilities and habitats. Ages 4-8 discover zoology, classification, and biological adaptations through interactive adventures.

name: PBS Kids - Peg + Cat: Chicken Problem
description: Solve math problems with Peg and Cat using addition and subtraction. Count chickens and solve real-world word problems. Ages 3-5 develop early numeracy, counting skills, and problem-solving strategies.

name: PBS Kids - Design Squad: Build a Skyscraper
description: Engineering design challenge building stable structures. Test materials, design foundations, and create earthquake-resistant buildings. Ages 6-8 learn structural engineering, material properties, and iterative design.
stem_fields: Engineering, Structural Design, Physics, Problem Solving

name: PBS Kids - Dinosaur Train: Dinosaur Sorting
description: Classification and sorting activity with dinosaurs. Sort dinosaurs by characteristics including diet, habitat, and time period. Ages 3-6 develop scientific classification, categorization, and logical thinking.

name: PBS Kids - Odd Squad: Odd Squad Gadget Lab
description: Solve math mysteries using gadgets and problem-solving. Apply arithmetic, patterns, and logic to complete agent missions. Ages 5-8 develop computational thinking and mathematical reasoning.

name: PBS Kids - Nature Cat: Nature Explore
description: Outdoor science exploration with Nature Cat. Investigate ecosystems, weather, and natural phenomena. Ages 3-6 learn earth science, biology, and environmental awareness through virtual nature adventures.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Ecology, Biology, Environmental Science

name: PBS Kids - Molly of Denali: Sled Dog Dash
description: Math and strategy game planning sled dog race routes. Calculate distances, estimate time, and manage resources. Ages 5-8 apply measurement, estimation, and problem-solving while learning Alaskan culture.

name: PBS Kids - Ready Jet Go!: Jet's Planet Pinball
description: Space science and astronomy game exploring the solar system. Learn planet characteristics, orbits, and space facts through pinball gameplay. Ages 4-7 discover astronomy and planetary science.
stem_fields: Astronomy, Space Science, Planetary Science, Physics

name: PBS Kids - Elinor Wonders Why: Backyard Exploration
description: Scientific inquiry and observation with Elinor. Ask questions, make predictions, and test hypotheses about nature. Ages 3-6 develop scientific method, inquiry skills, and curiosity through investigation.

name: PBS Kids - Arthur: Cast Your Vote
description: Data analysis and graphing activity with Arthur. Conduct surveys, collect data, and create graphs to analyze results. Ages 5-8 learn statistics, data visualization, and democratic processes.

name: PBS Kids - Plum Landing: Mission to Mars
description: Space exploration engineering challenge. Design Mars rovers, plan missions, and solve planetary science problems. Ages 6-8 develop engineering design process and space science knowledge.
stem_fields: Engineering, Space Science, Robotics, Problem Solving

name: PBS Kids - Sesame Street: Cookie Monster's Challenge
description: Self-regulation and problem-solving with Cookie Monster. Complete puzzles requiring patience, planning, and strategy. Ages 3-5 develop executive function, patience, and mathematical thinking.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Logic, Problem Solving, Executive Function

name: PBS Kids - Cat in the Hat: Sorting
description: Classification and sorting with Cat in the Hat. Sort objects by color, size, shape, and function. Ages 3-5 develop categorization, attributes recognition, and logical thinking through interactive play.

name: PBS Kids - Splash and Bubbles: Coral Reef Exploration
description: Marine biology and ocean science with underwater friends. Explore coral reefs, identify sea creatures, and learn ocean ecosystems. Ages 4-7 discover marine life, habitats, and conservation.

name: PBS Kids - Daniel Tiger: Neighborhood Helpers
description: Social-emotional learning and community helpers. Learn about occupations including doctors, engineers, and scientists. Ages 2-4 develop career awareness and social understanding.
stem_fields: Career Awareness, Community, Social Skills, STEM Careers

name: PBS Kids - Clifford: Measurement Fun
description: Measurement and comparison with Clifford the Big Red Dog. Compare sizes, measure lengths, and understand relative measurements. Ages 3-6 develop measurement concepts and spatial reasoning.

name: PBS Kids - Xavier Riddle: Historical STEM Figures
description: Learn about historical scientists and inventors. Meet Marie Curie, Alexander Graham Bell, and other STEM pioneers. Ages 4-7 discover science history and develop growth mindset.
stem_fields: Science History, Biography, STEM Careers, Inspiration

name: PBS Kids - Super Why: Letter Power
description: Literacy meets logic with letter recognition and word building. Decode words, spell answers, and solve reading puzzles. Ages 3-6 develop phonics, decoding, and early reading skills.

name: PBS Kids - Hero Elementary: Superpowers of Science
description: Science superheroes solve problems using scientific method. Investigate, experiment, and apply science to help community. Ages 4-7 learn inquiry process, observation, and critical thinking.
stem_fields: Scientific Method, Inquiry, Problem Solving, Critical Thinking

name: PBS Kids - Pinkalicious: Pattern Play
description: Pattern recognition and creation with Pinkalicious. Identify, extend, and create patterns using colors, shapes, and objects. Ages 3-6 develop algebraic thinking and pattern recognition.

name: PBS Kids - Games App
description: Free mobile app with 100+ educational games. Download for offline play on tablets and phones. Ages 2-8 access PBS Kids STEM content anywhere without internet connection.
stem_fields: Multi-Subject STEM, Mobile Learning, Educational Technology

name: PBS Kids - Video Player: STEM Episodes
description: Free streaming of full-length STEM educational episodes. Watch shows including Wild Kratts, Cyberchase, Sid the Science Kid, and more. Ages 2-8 access curriculum-aligned science and math content.
stem_fields: Multi-Subject STEM, Educational Media, Science Communication

name: PBS Kids - Spanish Language Resources
description: Bilingual STEM games and content in Spanish. Support dual language learners and Spanish-speaking families. Ages 2-8 access culturally responsive STEM education in multiple languages.
stem_fields: Multi-Subject STEM, Bilingual Education, Language Support

name: PBS Kids - Accessibility Features
description: Closed captions, audio descriptions, and accessible controls. Support children with disabilities and diverse learning needs. Ages 2-8 access inclusive STEM learning with adaptive features.
stem_fields: Accessible Education, Inclusive Design, Universal Design for Learning

name: Pioneer Academics - Summer Session Online Research Program
description: Intensive 5-week online research program for academically motivated high school students. Work one-on-one with university professors from top institutions worldwide. Conduct original research culminating in scholarly paper. Choose from 30+ research subjects across STEM, social sciences, and humanities. Weekly live seminars with professor mentor. Develop critical thinking, research methodology, and academic writing skills. Flexible scheduling accommodating students globally. Research paper can be submitted to academic journals and competitions. Highly selective admissions based on academics and intellectual curiosity.
stem_fields: Research, Academic Writing, Critical Thinking, Interdisciplinary Studies

name: Pioneer Academics - Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
description: Research track exploring artificial intelligence, machine learning algorithms, and neural networks. Work with professor specializing in AI to develop original research project. Topics may include computer vision, natural language processing, reinforcement learning, or AI ethics. Implement machine learning models and analyze results. Learn Python programming and AI frameworks. Research applications of AI to real-world problems. Produce scholarly paper suitable for publication or competition submission.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Neural Networks, Data Science

name: Pioneer Academics - Biotechnology and Genetic Engineering
description: Research in cutting-edge biotechnology including CRISPR, gene therapy, and synthetic biology. Mentored by professor with expertise in molecular biology and genetics. Design theoretical or computational research project exploring genetic engineering applications. Study bioethics and societal implications of biotechnology. Research topics may include disease treatment, agricultural applications, or biomanufacturing. Analyze genomic data and biological systems. Write comprehensive research paper on original findings.
stem_fields: Biotechnology, Genetics, CRISPR, Molecular Biology, Bioengineering

name: Pioneer Academics - Neuroscience and Cognitive Science
description: Research exploring brain function, cognition, and behavior. Work with neuroscience professor on topics like neural circuits, memory, consciousness, or neurological disorders. Study intersection of biology, psychology, and computational neuroscience. Research methods may include literature review, data analysis, or computational modeling. Investigate questions about learning, decision-making, or brain plasticity. Develop deep understanding of neuroscience research methods and current frontiers.
stem_fields: Neuroscience, Cognitive Science, Psychology, Biology, Brain Research

name: Pioneer Academics - Astrophysics and Cosmology
description: Research in astrophysics, cosmology, and space science. Work with astronomy professor on topics like exoplanets, black holes, dark matter, or the early universe. Analyze astronomical data, study theoretical physics, or explore observational techniques. Research questions about stellar evolution, galaxy formation, or fundamental physics. Learn computational methods for astrophysics. Produce research paper contributing to understanding of the cosmos.
stem_fields: Astrophysics, Astronomy, Cosmology, Physics, Space Science

name: Pioneer Academics - Environmental Science and Climate Change
description: Research addressing environmental challenges and climate science. Work with environmental science professor on sustainability, climate modeling, conservation, or renewable energy. Analyze environmental data, study ecosystem dynamics, or explore policy solutions. Research topics may include carbon sequestration, biodiversity loss, ocean acidification, or green technology. Interdisciplinary approach combining science, policy, and ethics. Develop solutions-oriented research contributing to environmental understanding.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Climate Science, Ecology, Sustainability, Conservation

name: Pioneer Academics - Computer Science and Algorithms
description: Research in theoretical or applied computer science. Work with CS professor on algorithms, complexity theory, cryptography, or software engineering. Design and analyze algorithms, explore computational theory, or develop applications. Research may involve coding implementations, mathematical proofs, or system design. Topics can include graph theory, optimization, parallel computing, or computational biology. Build strong foundation in computer science research methodology.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Algorithms, Programming, Software Engineering, Theoretical CS

name: Pioneer Academics - Mathematics and Number Theory
description: Research in pure or applied mathematics. Work with mathematics professor on topics like number theory, combinatorics, topology, or mathematical modeling. Explore theoretical questions or applications of mathematics to other fields. Research may involve proving theorems, analyzing mathematical structures, or developing models. Study connections between different areas of mathematics. Develop mathematical reasoning and proof-writing skills. Produce rigorous mathematical research paper.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Number Theory, Pure Math, Applied Math, Mathematical Modeling

name: Pioneer Academics - Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
description: Research in biochemistry exploring protein structure, enzyme function, or metabolic pathways. Work with biochemistry professor on topics like drug discovery, structural biology, or cellular processes. Study molecular mechanisms of life at atomic and molecular scales. Research may involve computational analysis, literature review, or theoretical modeling. Topics can include protein folding, signal transduction, or gene regulation. Develop understanding of modern biochemistry research.
stem_fields: Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Protein Science, Cell Biology, Enzymology

name: Pioneer Academics - Physics and Quantum Mechanics
description: Research in theoretical or experimental physics. Work with physics professor on topics like quantum mechanics, particle physics, condensed matter, or thermodynamics. Explore fundamental questions about nature of reality and physical laws. Research may involve mathematical analysis, computational simulations, or thought experiments. Topics can include quantum computing, relativity, superconductivity, or statistical mechanics. Develop deep understanding of physics principles and research methods.
stem_fields: Physics, Quantum Mechanics, Theoretical Physics, Particle Physics, Condensed Matter

name: Pioneer Academics - Chemistry and Materials Science
description: Research in organic, inorganic, physical chemistry, or materials science. Work with chemistry professor on topics like chemical synthesis, reaction mechanisms, or novel materials. Study catalysis, nanomaterials, polymers, or drug design. Research may involve computational chemistry, literature analysis, or theoretical modeling. Topics can include sustainable chemistry, battery technology, or medicinal chemistry. Develop understanding of chemical principles and research methodology.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Nanotechnology, Organic Chemistry

name: Pioneer Academics - Engineering and Robotics
description: Research in mechanical, electrical, or computer engineering. Work with engineering professor on topics like robotics, control systems, or engineering design. Study automation, sensor systems, or mechatronics. Research may involve design projects, simulations, or optimization problems. Topics can include autonomous vehicles, renewable energy systems, or biomedical devices. Develop engineering problem-solving and design thinking skills.
stem_fields: Engineering, Robotics, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Design

name: Pioneer Academics - Data Science and Statistics
description: Research in data science, statistical analysis, or machine learning applications. Work with data science professor on topics like predictive modeling, big data analytics, or statistical inference. Study data visualization, experimental design, or causal inference. Research may involve analyzing real-world datasets or developing new statistical methods. Topics can include sports analytics, healthcare data, or social network analysis. Learn R, Python, and statistical software.
stem_fields: Data Science, Statistics, Analytics, Machine Learning, Quantitative Analysis

name: Pioneer Academics - Biomedical Science and Medicine
description: Research in biomedical sciences exploring disease mechanisms, treatments, or medical technology. Work with medical school professor on topics like cancer biology, immunology, or drug development. Study pathophysiology, clinical research, or public health. Research may involve literature analysis, data mining, or theoretical modeling. Topics can include personalized medicine, vaccine development, or regenerative medicine. Explore career paths in medicine and biomedical research.
stem_fields: Biomedical Science, Medicine, Immunology, Pathology, Clinical Research

name: Pioneer Academics - Economics and Game Theory
description: Research in economics, game theory, or behavioral economics. Work with economics professor on topics like market dynamics, strategic decision-making, or economic modeling. Study microeconomics, macroeconomics, or econometrics. Research may involve mathematical modeling, data analysis, or theoretical exploration. Topics can include auction theory, mechanism design, financial markets, or development economics. Develop quantitative economic analysis skills.
stem_fields: Economics, Game Theory, Mathematics, Behavioral Economics, Quantitative Analysis

name: Pioneer Academics - Public Health and Epidemiology
description: Research in public health addressing disease prevention, health policy, or epidemiology. Work with public health professor on topics like infectious diseases, health disparities, or healthcare systems. Study statistical analysis of health data, disease modeling, or intervention evaluation. Research may explore social determinants of health, vaccine efficacy, or health communication. Topics can include pandemic response, health equity, or global health challenges.
stem_fields: Public Health, Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Health Policy, Disease Prevention

name: Pioneer Academics - Applied Mathematics and Optimization
description: Research in applied mathematics focusing on optimization, operations research, or mathematical modeling. Work with professor on topics like linear programming, network flows, or algorithm optimization. Study applications of mathematics to real-world problems in logistics, finance, or engineering. Research may involve developing models, proving optimality, or computational implementations. Topics can include combinatorial optimization, stochastic processes, or numerical methods.
stem_fields: Applied Mathematics, Optimization, Operations Research, Mathematical Modeling, Algorithms

name: Pioneer Academics - Scholarship and Financial Aid Program
