description: Merit-based and need-based scholarships available for exceptional students. Partial scholarships reducing program cost for qualified applicants. Selection based on academic excellence, research potential, and financial need. Commitment to making research opportunities accessible to students from all backgrounds. Application process considers financial circumstances. Focus on identifying talented students regardless of ability to pay. Supporting diversity in undergraduate-level research education.

name: Polygence - Core Research Program
description: One-on-one research mentorship program pairing high school students ages 13-18 with PhD and Masters-level mentors. Students explore academic interests through personalized research projects in any subject area. Work directly with expert mentor over 10-14 weeks conducting original research. Choose between research paper, literature review, creative project, or other deliverables. Flexible scheduling with weekly 1-hour sessions. Access to 300+ mentors from top universities worldwide. Develop research skills, critical thinking, and academic writing. Perfect for college applications and intellectual growth. Rolling admissions year-round.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Polygence - Research Paper Track
description: Traditional academic research track culminating in scholarly research paper. Work with mentor to develop research question, conduct literature review, and analyze findings. Learn academic writing conventions and citation styles. Produce 3,000-7,000 word research paper suitable for publication or competition submission. Topics span all disciplines including biology, computer science, physics, psychology, engineering, and more. Mentor provides feedback on drafts and guides research methodology. Ideal for students interested in scientific inquiry and academic careers.
stem_fields: Research Methods, Academic Writing, Scientific Inquiry, All STEM Fields

name: Polygence - Passion Project Track
description: Creative project track for students who want to explore interests through hands-on work. Develop website, mobile app, documentary, podcast, art installation, or other creative deliverable. Mentor guides project planning, execution, and presentation. Combine technical skills with personal interests. Examples include developing AI chatbot, creating science education videos, designing engineering prototype, or building data visualization. More flexible format allowing creative expression while developing practical skills. Perfect for entrepreneurial and creative students.
stem_fields: Project-Based Learning, Technology, Engineering, Creative Application, Innovation

name: Polygence - Literature Review Track
description: Comprehensive survey of existing research in chosen field. Work with mentor to identify research gap, find relevant sources, and synthesize findings. Learn systematic review methods and critical analysis of academic literature. Produce structured literature review evaluating current state of knowledge. Develop skills in academic database searching, source evaluation, and scholarly writing. Ideal for students beginning research journey or exploring field before empirical study. Excellent foundation for future original research.
stem_fields: Research Methods, Literature Analysis, Critical Thinking, Academic Writing

name: Polygence - Computer Science and AI Projects
description: One-on-one mentorship in computer science, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. Build software applications, train neural networks, or explore computational theory. Projects can include developing web apps, creating machine learning models, building games, or analyzing algorithms. Mentors with expertise in Python, Java, C++, and AI frameworks. Learn software engineering best practices and computer science fundamentals. Develop portfolio-worthy projects for college applications and internships.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Software Development, Programming

name: Polygence - Biotechnology and Life Sciences
description: Research mentorship in biology, biotechnology, and life sciences. Explore topics like genetics, molecular biology, neuroscience, or ecology. Projects may involve computational biology, bioinformatics analysis, or theoretical research. Work with PhD mentors from top biology programs. Topics can include CRISPR applications, disease mechanisms, synthetic biology, or evolutionary studies. Learn biological research methods and scientific thinking. Produce research suitable for science competitions and journals.
stem_fields: Biology, Biotechnology, Genetics, Neuroscience, Life Sciences, Bioinformatics

name: Polygence - Engineering and Design
description: One-on-one mentorship in engineering disciplines and design thinking. Explore mechanical, electrical, chemical, or biomedical engineering. Projects may involve CAD modeling, circuit design, materials analysis, or engineering optimization. Work with engineering professors and industry professionals. Learn design process from problem identification to solution testing. Develop engineering portfolio showcasing technical skills and problem-solving abilities.
stem_fields: Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Design, Problem Solving

name: Polygence - Physics and Mathematics
description: Research mentorship in physics, mathematics, and related fields. Explore theoretical physics, applied mathematics, astrophysics, or computational physics. Projects may involve mathematical modeling, physics simulations, or theoretical analysis. Work with mentors from prestigious physics and math programs. Topics can include quantum mechanics, cosmology, number theory, or mathematical physics. Develop rigorous analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
stem_fields: Physics, Mathematics, Astrophysics, Mathematical Modeling, Theoretical Science

name: Polygence - Environmental Science and Sustainability
description: Research mentorship in environmental science, climate change, and sustainability. Explore ecology, conservation, renewable energy, or environmental policy. Projects may involve data analysis, climate modeling, or sustainability solutions. Work with mentors specializing in environmental sciences. Topics can include biodiversity, carbon emissions, green technology, or environmental justice. Develop research addressing pressing environmental challenges.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Climate Science, Ecology, Sustainability, Conservation

name: Polygence - Chemistry and Materials Science
description: One-on-one research in chemistry and materials science. Explore organic chemistry, physical chemistry, or nanotechnology. Projects may involve computational chemistry, materials analysis, or chemical research. Work with chemistry PhD mentors. Topics can include drug design, catalysis, polymer science, or green chemistry. Learn chemical thinking and research methodology. Produce research suitable for chemistry competitions.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Materials Science, Nanotechnology, Chemical Engineering, Organic Chemistry

name: Polygence - Data Science and Analytics
description: Research mentorship in data science, statistics, and analytics. Learn data collection, cleaning, analysis, and visualization. Projects may involve building predictive models, analyzing large datasets, or creating interactive dashboards. Work with data science professionals and statisticians. Topics can include sports analytics, public health data, financial modeling, or social media analysis. Develop skills in Python, R, and data science tools.
stem_fields: Data Science, Statistics, Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Visualization

name: Polygence - Psychology and Cognitive Science
description: Research mentorship in psychology, neuroscience, and cognitive science. Explore behavioral psychology, cognitive processes, or mental health. Projects may involve literature reviews, survey research, or experimental design. Work with psychology PhD mentors. Topics can include memory, decision-making, social psychology, or developmental psychology. Learn psychological research methods and statistical analysis.
stem_fields: Psychology, Cognitive Science, Neuroscience, Behavioral Science, Research Methods

name: Polygence - Scholarship and Financial Aid
description: Need-based scholarships available for talented students from underrepresented backgrounds. Partial and full scholarships reducing financial barriers to research mentorship. Application process considers academic achievement, passion for learning, and financial need. Commitment to increasing diversity in research education. Making one-on-one mentorship accessible regardless of family income. Focus on supporting first-generation college students and underrepresented minorities in STEM. Rolling scholarship applications throughout year.
stem_fields: Financial Aid, Scholarships, Access, Diversity, Equity

description: Competition testing statistical analysis, probability theory, and real-world data interpretation. Includes individual and team categories.

description: Special competition designed for elementary students to explore basic STEM concepts through hands-on projects, simple experiments, and creative problem-solving.

name: Boston University RISE Practicum
description: 6-week intensive summer research program at Boston University for rising high school seniors. Students conduct original research in life sciences, physical sciences, or engineering. Work in university laboratories with faculty mentors and graduate students. Residential program with housing and meals provided. Daily research, seminars, and scientific writing workshops. Produce research poster and presentation. Competitive admissions requiring strong STEM grades and passion for research. Program fee with need-based financial aid available. College credit option.
stem_fields: Life Sciences, Physical Sciences, Engineering, Laboratory Research

name: MIT RISE - Research in Science and Engineering
description: 7-week summer research program at MIT for underrepresented high school students. Conduct research in engineering, computer science, or life sciences. Work with MIT faculty on authentic research projects. Program completely free including housing, meals, and stipend. Academic enrichment workshops and college preparation sessions. Focus on increasing diversity in STEM research. Strong preference for students from underrepresented minorities, women, first-generation college students, and low-income backgrounds. Minimum 3.0 GPA required.
stem_fields: Engineering, Computer Science, Life Sciences, Research Methods

name: Stanford RISE Summer Research Program
description: 8-week residential research program at Stanford University for high school juniors and seniors. Students work in Stanford research labs conducting biomedical, engineering, or computational research. One-on-one mentorship from graduate students and faculty. Weekly seminars on research skills, graduate school applications, and scientific careers. Housing and meals provided. Research presentation at end of summer. Need-based financial aid available reducing barriers. Preference for students from underrepresented backgrounds in STEM.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Engineering, Computational Science, Laboratory Science

name: Caltech RISE Research Program
description: 10-week summer research immersion at Caltech for exceptional high school students. Work full-time in Caltech research laboratories on projects in physics, chemistry, biology, or engineering. Stipend provided along with housing. Weekly seminars and research group meetings. Opportunity to present at research conferences. Highly competitive admissions emphasizing academic excellence and research potential. Strong letters of recommendation and prior research experience valued. Produce publication-quality research.

name: NIH RISE Summer Research Program
description: 8-week summer research internship at National Institutes of Health for high school students interested in biomedical research. Work alongside NIH scientists on health-related research projects. Stipend provided. Commuter program in Bethesda, MD area. Research areas include cancer biology, neuroscience, genetics, immunology, and public health. Weekly seminars and career development workshops. Produce research poster. Priority for local students and those from disadvantaged backgrounds. Strong science grades required.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Cancer Biology, Neuroscience, Genetics, Immunology, Public Health

name: UC Berkeley RISE Research Internship
description: 6-week summer research program at UC Berkeley for California high school students. Conduct research in life sciences, physical sciences, or engineering with Berkeley faculty. Residential option available or commuter. Research project culminating in poster presentation. College credit offered. Financial aid available for students with demonstrated need. Focus on preparing students for college-level research. Laboratory safety training and research ethics workshops included.
stem_fields: Life Sciences, Physical Sciences, Engineering, Environmental Science

name: Carnegie Mellon RISE Computer Science Research
description: 7-week summer research program focusing on computer science and robotics at Carnegie Mellon University. High school students work on AI, machine learning, human-computer interaction, or robotics projects. Mentored by CMU faculty and PhD students. Residential program with housing and meals. Weekly tech talks and professional development. Produce working prototype or research paper. Program fee with need-based scholarships available. Preference for women and underrepresented minorities in CS.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Robotics, Human-Computer Interaction

name: Columbia RISE Biomedical Research
description: 8-week summer biomedical research program at Columbia University Medical Center for NYC-area high school students. Work in medical research laboratories studying disease mechanisms, drug development, or public health. Mentored by Columbia faculty and medical students. Commuter program with stipend. Weekly seminars on careers in medicine and research. Hospital tours and clinical exposure. Focus on students from underserved communities. Minimum 3.0 GPA in science courses.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Medicine, Drug Development, Public Health, Clinical Research

name: University of Washington RISE Engineering Research
description: 6-week engineering research program for Pacific Northwest high school students. Conduct research in mechanical, electrical, civil, or biomedical engineering at UW. Faculty-mentored projects addressing real-world engineering challenges. Mix of residential and commuter options. Weekly design workshops and professional development. Build engineering portfolio. Financial aid available. Emphasis on recruiting women and minorities into engineering fields.
stem_fields: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Biomedical Engineering

name: Yale RISE Summer Research Program
description: 8-week residential research experience at Yale University for high school students. Research in biological sciences, chemistry, physics, or environmental science. Work alongside Yale researchers on ongoing projects. Housing, meals, and stipend provided. Scientific communication workshops and graduate school preparation. Research symposium at program end. Highly selective admissions. Priority for underrepresented minorities and first-generation college-bound students. Strong academic record required.
stem_fields: Biological Sciences, Chemistry, Physics, Environmental Science

name: University of Michigan RISE Research Fellows
description: 7-week summer research fellowship at University of Michigan for Midwest high school students. Research in natural sciences, engineering, or mathematics. Close mentorship from U-M faculty and graduate students. Residential program with housing and meals. Weekly research seminars and career panels. Develop research proposal, conduct experiments, and present findings. Need-based financial aid available. Focus on students from rural and underserved urban areas.
stem_fields: Natural Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, Research Methods

name: Georgia Tech RISE Engineering and Computing
description: 6-week summer research program at Georgia Institute of Technology for high school students interested in engineering and computer science. Work on research projects in robotics, cybersecurity, materials science, or sustainable engineering. Faculty mentorship and hands-on laboratory work. Residential program in Atlanta. College credit option. Financial aid available for Georgia residents and students with demonstrated need. Team-based and individual research projects.
stem_fields: Engineering, Computer Science, Robotics, Cybersecurity, Materials Science

name: University of Texas RISE Biotech Research
description: 8-week biotechnology research program at UT Austin for Texas high school students. Conduct research in genetic engineering, bioinformatics, or pharmaceutical sciences. Laboratory immersion with daily research activities. Commuter and residential options available. Weekly seminars on biotechnology careers and graduate school. Research poster presentation. Financial aid for students from low-income families. Minimum 3.0 GPA required.
stem_fields: Biotechnology, Genetic Engineering, Bioinformatics, Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Northwestern RISE Materials Science Research
description: 7-week summer research program at Northwestern University focusing on materials science and nanotechnology. High school students work in cutting-edge research facilities on nanomaterials, polymers, or energy materials. Mentored by materials science faculty. Residential program in Evanston, IL. Clean room and advanced microscopy training. Research presentation at end of program. Competitive admissions. Financial aid available based on need.
stem_fields: Materials Science, Nanotechnology, Polymers, Energy Materials, Chemistry

name: Duke RISE Environmental Science Research
description: 6-week environmental science research program at Duke University for rising high school seniors. Conduct field and laboratory research on climate change, ecology, or environmental policy. Work with Duke faculty in Nicholas School of Environment. Mix of field work and data analysis. Residential program with housing and meals. Sustainability-focused curriculum. Research project on local or global environmental issue. Need-based scholarships available.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Climate Change, Ecology, Environmental Policy, Sustainability

name: University of Illinois RISE Physics and Astronomy
description: 8-week summer research program in physics and astronomy at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. High school students conduct research using observatory facilities or physics laboratories. Projects in astrophysics, particle physics, or condensed matter physics. Mentored by physics faculty and graduate students. Residential program. Weekly colloquia and lab tours. Produce research paper or poster. Financial aid available for Illinois residents.
stem_fields: Physics, Astronomy, Astrophysics, Particle Physics, Observatory Research

name: Johns Hopkins RISE Neuroscience Research
description: 7-week neuroscience research program at Johns Hopkins University for high school students passionate about brain science. Work in neuroscience laboratories studying cognition, behavior, or neurological diseases. Mentored by Johns Hopkins faculty and medical students. Residential program in Baltimore. Hospital and lab tours. Weekly seminars on neuroscience careers and medical school. Research presentation at program end. Need-based financial aid available.
stem_fields: Neuroscience, Brain Science, Cognitive Science, Neurobiology, Medical Research

name: University of Pennsylvania RISE Bioengineering
description: 6-week bioengineering research program at UPenn for high school students interested in medical devices, tissue engineering, or computational biology. Work in Penn bioengineering laboratories on cutting-edge projects. Faculty mentorship and graduate student collaboration. Residential program in Philadelphia. Engineering design workshops and medical device demonstrations. Research poster at program end. Competitive admissions. Financial aid available.
stem_fields: Bioengineering, Medical Devices, Tissue Engineering, Computational Biology

name: Rice University RISE Research Experience
description: 7-week summer research program at Rice University for Texas and Louisiana high school students. Research in physical sciences, life sciences, or engineering. Small cohort with individualized mentorship from Rice faculty. Residential program in Houston. Weekly workshops on scientific writing, presentations, and college applications. Research symposium showcasing student work. Need-based financial aid reducing program costs. Focus on recruiting diverse student body.
stem_fields: Physical Sciences, Life Sciences, Engineering, Research Methods

name: Roblox Education - Introduction to Roblox Studio
description: Beginner course teaching basics of Roblox Studio development environment. Learn interface navigation, building tools, terrain creation, and basic scripting. Create first 3D world and learn fundamental game development concepts.

name: Roblox Education - Coding with Lua Fundamentals
description: Learn Lua programming language fundamentals through Roblox Studio. Cover variables, data types, conditional statements, loops, functions, and debugging. Project-based approach creating interactive game elements.

name: Roblox Education - Game Design and Development Pathway
description: Comprehensive learning pathway from beginner to advanced game creator. Multi-course curriculum covering design thinking, prototyping, player experience, monetization, and publishing. Build portfolio of completed games.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Game Design, Programming, Entrepreneurship

name: Roblox Education - 3D Modeling and Environment Design
description: Create 3D assets and immersive environments in Roblox Studio. Learn part manipulation, mesh importing, terrain tools, lighting, and visual effects. Build detailed worlds and game settings.

name: Roblox Education - Creating an Obby (Obstacle Course)
description: Popular project-based course building classic Roblox obstacle course game. Learn game mechanics, challenge design, checkpoints, spawning, and player testing. Complete functional game by end of course.

name: Roblox Education - Scripting with Events and Functions
description: Intermediate Lua scripting focusing on event-driven programming and function creation. Learn player input handling, collision detection, timers, and creating reusable code. Build interactive game mechanics.

name: Roblox Education - User Interface (UI) Design
description: Design and script graphical user interfaces for Roblox games. Learn GUI objects, screen positioning, buttons, health bars, menus, and player feedback systems. Create polished user experiences.

name: Roblox Education - Combat and Weapon Systems
description: Create combat mechanics for action games. Learn health systems, damage calculation, weapon tools, projectiles, and combat balancing. Understand game balance and player engagement through combat design.
stem_fields: Game Design, Programming, Mathematics, Systems Thinking

name: Roblox Education - Multiplayer Game Development
description: Learn server-client architecture and multiplayer game programming. Understand remote events, data persistence, player synchronization, and anti-cheat basics. Build games supporting multiple concurrent players.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Network Programming, Game Design

name: Roblox Education - Data Stores and Player Progression
description: Implement persistent data systems saving player progress across sessions. Learn DataStore service, data serialization, leaderboards, achievements, and player inventory systems. Create engaging progression mechanics.

name: Roblox Education - Monetization and Game Economics
description: Learn ethical game monetization through Developer Products and Game Passes. Understand virtual economies, pricing strategies, player value, and sustainable business models. Introduction to game entrepreneurship.

name: Roblox Education - Animation and Character Rigging
description: Create custom character animations and rigs in Roblox Studio. Learn animation editor, keyframes, easing styles, and character customization. Build unique character movements and emotes.

name: Roblox Education - Sound Design and Audio Programming
description: Integrate sound effects and music into Roblox games. Learn audio properties, 3D spatial audio, background music systems, and triggering sounds through scripts. Create immersive audio experiences.

name: Roblox Education - Game Testing and Optimization
description: Learn professional game testing methodologies, performance optimization, and debugging strategies. Understand frame rate, memory management, and creating smooth player experiences across devices.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Quality Assurance

name: Roblox Education - Publishing and Marketing Your Game
description: Final steps in game development lifecycle: publishing, metadata optimization, thumbnail creation, description writing, and player acquisition strategies. Learn how to grow game audience.

name: Roblox Education - Community and Developer Forum
description: Access to global Roblox developer community and forums. Get help from experienced developers, share projects, participate in challenges, and learn from community tutorials. Peer-to-peer learning platform.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Game Design, Community Learning

name: Samsung Solve for Tomorrow - National STEM Competition
description: Annual nationwide competition challenging grades 6-12 public school students to solve real-world issues in their communities using STEM. Teams of students and teachers propose solutions to local problems through science, technology, engineering, and math. Multi-phase competition with prizes up to $100,000 in technology and grants. Focus on environmental sustainability, health, education access, or community challenges. Virtual participation with potential for national recognition. Free entry with teacher sponsor required.
stem_fields: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, Problem Solving

name: Samsung Solve for Tomorrow - Phase 2: State Finalists
description: 150 state finalist teams selected to develop detailed solution plans. Create video pitch explaining problem, research, and proposed STEM solution. Teams conduct community needs assessment and design project plan. Winners receive $2,000 Samsung technology package and classroom supplies. Access to Samsung mentors and curriculum resources. Semifinalist announcement in December.
stem_fields: Project Design, Research, Video Production, STEM Application

name: Samsung Solve for Tomorrow - Phase 3: National Finalists
description: 30 national finalist teams develop working prototypes and implementation plans. Build and test solution, collect data, and refine design. Create comprehensive project documentation and presentation. Teams receive $15,000 technology package and classroom supplies. Virtual mentorship from Samsung employees and STEM professionals. Advance to pitch competition.
stem_fields: Prototyping, Testing, Data Analysis, Engineering Design

name: Samsung Solve for Tomorrow - National Winner Pitch Competition
description: Top 10 teams compete in virtual pitch event presenting solutions to judges. Professional presentation with Q&A demonstrating STEM knowledge and project impact. Winners receive additional prizes: 1st place $100,000, 2nd place $50,000, 3rd place $20,000 in technology and school funding. National recognition and media coverage. Networking with STEM professionals.
stem_fields: Presentation Skills, Communication, STEM Demonstration, Public Speaking

name: Samsung Solve for Tomorrow - Alumni Network
description: Network of past participants and winning teams. Access to alumni events, continued mentorship, and college/career guidance. Showcase successful projects inspiring future participants. Connection to Samsung STEM initiatives and internship opportunities.
stem_fields: Networking, Mentorship, Career Development, Alumni Relations

name: Scholly - National STEM Achievement Scholarship
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for high school students pursuing STEM degrees. Open to all students with minimum 3.0 GPA in STEM courses. Essay required describing STEM passion and career goals. All STEM majors eligible including science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. One-time award for college expenses. No geographic restrictions. Application includes transcript and letter of recommendation.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Scholly - Black Students in STEM Scholarship
description: $2,500-$10,000 scholarship specifically for Black high school students pursuing STEM careers. Recognizing and supporting Black excellence in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. Essay about overcoming challenges and commitment to STEM. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Priority for students from underserved communities. Renewable with reapplication and maintaining good academic standing. Multiple awards given annually.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Scholly - Future Coders Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students learning programming and computer science. Open to high school students with interest in software development, web development, or app creation. Submit portfolio of coding projects or essay about programming journey. All skill levels welcome from beginners to advanced. No minimum GPA requirement. Judges evaluate passion and potential over experience.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Software Development, Web Development

name: Scholly - Women in Tech Scholarship
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for female students pursuing computer science or technology degrees. Addressing gender gap in technology fields. Essay describing how you will contribute to diversity in tech industry. Minimum 3.0 GPA preferred. Open to all high school grades. Preference for students participating in coding clubs, hackathons, or tech competitions.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Technology, Software Engineering, Information Technology

name: Scholly - Cybersecurity Future Leaders Award
description: $1,500-$3,000 scholarship for students interested in cybersecurity and information security careers. Open to students learning about ethical hacking, network security, or digital forensics. Essay about importance of cybersecurity in modern world. Participation in CyberPatriot or similar programs helpful. No GPA requirement. Focus on students committed to protecting digital infrastructure.
stem_fields: Cybersecurity, Information Security, Computer Science, Ethical Hacking

name: Scholly - AI and Machine Learning Scholarship
description: $500-$2,000 scholarship for students exploring artificial intelligence and machine learning. Open to students learning about neural networks, data science, or AI applications. Submit project description or essay about AI potential. All experience levels welcome. Emphasis on ethical AI development and social applications of machine learning.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science

name: Scholly - Aspiring Engineers Scholarship
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for high school students planning to pursue engineering degrees. All engineering disciplines eligible including mechanical, electrical, civil, chemical, and biomedical. Essay describing engineering problem you want to solve. Minimum 3.0 GPA preferred. Participation in robotics, engineering clubs, or STEM competitions encouraged.
stem_fields: Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering

name: Scholly - Women in Engineering Award
description: $2,000-$7,500 scholarship for female students pursuing engineering education. Addressing underrepresentation of women in engineering fields. Essay about overcoming gender barriers and engineering aspirations. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Priority for students from underrepresented minorities. Support for students who will be first in family to attend college.
stem_fields: Engineering, STEM, Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering

name: Scholly - Sustainable Engineering Scholarship
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students passionate about environmental engineering and sustainability. Open to students interested in renewable energy, green technology, or sustainable design. Essay describing how engineering can solve environmental challenges. No minimum GPA. Focus on innovative thinking and environmental commitment.
stem_fields: Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Renewable Energy, Sustainability

name: Scholly - Robotics and Automation Scholarship
description: $1,000-$4,000 scholarship for students interested in robotics engineering and automation. Participation in FIRST Robotics, VEX Robotics, or similar programs encouraged. Essay or video describing robotics project or team experience. Open to all skill levels. Emphasis on teamwork and problem-solving abilities.

name: Scholly - Future Scientists Award
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students pursuing careers in natural sciences. Open to students interested in biology, chemistry, physics, or earth sciences. Essay describing scientific question you want to answer. Science fair participation or research experience helpful but not required. Minimum 3.0 GPA in science courses preferred.
stem_fields: Science, Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Earth Science

name: Scholly - Environmental Science Leaders
description: $1,000-$4,000 scholarship for students passionate about environmental conservation and climate science. Essay about environmental issue affecting your community and proposed solutions. Open to students interested in environmental science, ecology, or conservation biology. Volunteer work in environmental organizations encouraged.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ecology, Conservation, Climate Science, Sustainability

name: Scholly - Biomedical Science Scholarship
description: $1,500-$5,000 scholarship for students interested in biomedical sciences and healthcare. Open to students pursuing biology, biochemistry, or pre-medicine. Essay describing disease or medical condition you want to research. Healthcare volunteering or laboratory experience valued. Commitment to improving health outcomes.
stem_fields: Biomedical Science, Biology, Biochemistry, Pre-Medicine, Health Science

name: Scholly - Chemistry Innovation Award
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students pursuing chemistry or chemical engineering. Open to students taking chemistry courses and interested in chemical research or industry. Essay about chemical innovation that impacts daily life. Laboratory coursework encouraged. No minimum GPA requirement.
stem_fields: Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry, Materials Science

name: Scholly - Physics and Astronomy Scholarship
description: $500-$2,000 scholarship for students passionate about physics or astronomy. Essay describing physics concept that fascinates you or astronomical discovery you find inspiring. Open to students taking physics courses. Participation in astronomy clubs or physics competitions encouraged. No GPA requirement.

name: Scholly - Math Excellence Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students excelling in mathematics. Open to students planning to major in mathematics, statistics, or actuarial science. Submit transcript showing strong math performance. Essay describing favorite math concept and real-world applications. Math competition participation helpful.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Actuarial Science

name: Scholly - Data Science Scholars
description: $1,000-$3,000 scholarship for students interested in data science and analytics. Open to students learning data analysis, statistical modeling, or data visualization. Submit portfolio of data projects or essay about data applications. Knowledge of Python or R helpful but not required.
stem_fields: Data Science, Statistics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science

name: Scholly - Minority STEM Leaders Scholarship
description: $1,500-$7,500 scholarship for underrepresented minority students pursuing STEM degrees. Open to Black, Hispanic/Latinx, and Native American students. Essay about experiences with diversity in STEM and future goals. Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Priority for first-generation college students and those from low-income families. Multiple awards annually.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Scholly - First-Generation STEM Scholars
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for first-generation college students pursuing STEM degrees. Open to students whose parents did not complete four-year college degree. Essay about challenges of being first-generation and commitment to STEM. Minimum 2.5 GPA. Priority for students from underrepresented minorities and low-income families.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Scholly - Low-Income STEM Achievers
description: $1,500-$7,500 scholarship for students from low-income families pursuing STEM degrees. Financial need-based award supporting students who face economic barriers. Essay about overcoming financial challenges while pursuing STEM. Documentation of family income required. Minimum 2.5 GPA. Multiple awards annually.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Scholly - Rural STEM Students Award
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students from rural communities pursuing STEM education. Recognizing unique challenges of accessing STEM opportunities in rural areas. Essay describing how rural background shapes STEM interests. Limited access to advanced courses will not count against applicants. Commitment to bringing STEM knowledge back to rural communities valued.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Scholly - STEM for Social Good Scholarship
description: $500-$2,500 scholarship for students planning to use STEM for positive social impact. Open to all STEM majors with community service orientation. Essay describing how you will apply STEM to help underserved communities. Volunteer work or community projects encouraged. No minimum GPA.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Social Impact, Community Service, Applied STEM

name: Scholly - Young Innovators STEM Award
description: $1,000-$5,000 scholarship for students demonstrating innovation in STEM. Open to students with inventions, research projects, or creative STEM solutions. Submit portfolio or project description. All STEM fields eligible. Judges evaluate originality, technical execution, and potential impact.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Innovation, Entrepreneurship, Applied Science

name: Scholly - High School STEM Research Award
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students conducting independent STEM research. Open to students with science fair projects, research internships, or independent studies. Submit research abstract or project description. All STEM research topics eligible. Judges evaluate research quality and student contribution.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Research, Scientific Method, Independent Study

name: Scholly - Students with Disabilities in STEM
description: $500-$3,000 scholarship for students with disabilities pursuing STEM education. Essay about how disability shapes your STEM approach and goals. All disabilities eligible including physical, learning, and mental health. Commitment to accessible STEM education and careers. No GPA requirement.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics

name: Balloon-Powered Car Challenge
description: Do you think you could build a car powered by nothing but air? A balloon-powered car is pushed forward by air escaping from a balloon, and it is fun and easy to build with materials you already have around your house. Can you imagine how you would want your own balloon-powered car to look? Can you design a car that will travel as far as possible?  You can even measure your car's speed using your smartphone and a special sensor app. Get ready to grab some simple supplies to bring your idea to lif
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Environmental Science

name: Understanding Project "Difficulty"
description: Science Buddies ranks each project within one of three categories of difficulty: For each category, there are three additional ranges of difficulty:
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Environmental Science

name: What Makes Ice Melt Fastest?
description: Andrew Olson, Ph.D., and Teisha Rowland, Ph.D., Science Buddies To determine which added material will make ice melt fastest.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Environmental Science

name: See Air Currents with Shadowgraphs and Schlieren Images
description: Have you ever wondered what the air currents look like around a candle? What about cold air flowing around an ice cube, or warm air rising from your hand? What about when you sneeze? We are surrounded by air currents all the time, but these subtle movements are completely invisible to the human eye. In this science project, you will take advantage of small changes in air density to make air currents visible in regular photographs and videos, using techniques called shadowgraphy and schlieren ima
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Environmental Science

name: Make Popping Boba Balls Out of Your Drinks
description: Forget drinking your juice. Instead, try snacking on it! Use the steps and recipes in this food science project to transform drinks into semi-solid balls that pop in your mouth. The technique is called spherification and it is part of a larger food science trend called molecular gastronomy but we just call it yummy science!
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Environmental Science

name: Growing Seeds in Different Soils
description: Investigate how different types of soil affect plant growth by planting seeds in various soil samples and measuring their growth over time.

name: Rainbow Milk Experiment
description: Explore surface tension and chemical reactions by adding food coloring and soap to milk to create colorful swirling patterns.

name: Testing Water Quality with pH Strips
description: Test the pH levels of different water sources around your community and analyze what factors might affect water acidity.

name: Building a Simple Robot
description: Design and build a simple robot using motors, sensors, and basic programming to complete specific tasks and challenges.

name: Crystal Growing Experiment
description: Grow different types of crystals using various solutions and compare their formation time, size, and structure.

name: DNA Extraction from Fruit
description: Extract and analyze DNA from different fruits using household materials to understand genetic material and molecular biology.

name: Solar Panel Efficiency Testing
description: Test how different variables like angle, shading, and temperature affect the efficiency of solar panels in generating electricity.

name: App Development for Data Collection
description: Create a mobile app to collect and analyze scientific data for research projects using programming and data science principles.

name: Elementary Metric Mastery
description: Students demonstrate understanding of metric units through measurement activities and conversions. Tests practical application of metric system in real-world scenarios.

name: Elementary Solar System
description: Students answer questions about the solar system, planets, moons, and space exploration. Includes identification of celestial objects and understanding of astronomical concepts.

name: Elementary Crime Busters
description: Students use scientific investigation techniques to solve mock crimes. Involves observation, evidence analysis, and basic forensic science principles.

name: Anatomy and Physiology
description: Students demonstrate understanding of human body systems through written tests and practical identification. Covers major organ systems and their functions.

name: Disease Detectives
description: Students investigate disease outbreaks, analyze epidemiological data, and understand public health principles. Includes case studies and data interpretation.

name: Experimental Design
description: Students design and conduct experiments to answer scientific questions. Emphasizes scientific method, controls, variables, and data analysis.

name: Fossils
description: Students identify fossils, understand geological time periods, and interpret paleontological evidence. Includes hands-on fossil identification and evolution concepts.

name: Mission Possible
description: Students build Rube Goldberg-style device to accomplish specific tasks through chain reactions. Tests engineering design and physics principles.

name: Road Scholar
description: Students answer questions about maps, navigation, and geographic features. Includes topographic map reading and spatial reasoning skills.

name: Astronomy
description: Students demonstrate knowledge of stellar evolution, galaxies, cosmology, and astronomical objects. Includes calculations and deep space phenomena.

name: Chemistry Lab
description: Hands-on chemistry laboratory event testing practical skills in chemical analysis, synthesis, and safety procedures. Includes qualitative and quantitative analysis.

name: Codebusters
description: Students solve various types of codes and ciphers, including historical and modern cryptographic methods. Tests pattern recognition and logical thinking.

name: Detector Building
description: Students build device to detect and measure electromagnetic radiation. Tests understanding of electronics, sensors, and measurement principles.

name: Environmental Chemistry
description: Students analyze environmental samples and understand chemical processes in ecosystems. Includes water quality testing and pollution analysis.

name: Forensics
description: Students analyze physical evidence from mock crime scenes using scientific techniques. Includes fingerprinting, DNA analysis, and trace evidence.

name: Geologic Mapping
description: Students interpret geologic maps, cross-sections, and understand Earth processes. Includes structural geology and mineral identification.

name: Ornithology
description: Students identify birds, understand bird behavior, ecology, and conservation. Includes anatomy, migration patterns, and habitat requirements.

name: Physics Lab
description: Hands-on physics laboratory event testing experimental skills and understanding of physical principles. Includes mechanics, waves, and thermodynamics.

name: Robot Tour
description: Students build autonomous robot to navigate course and complete tasks. Tests programming, sensors, and mechanical design skills.

name: Wind Power
description: Students build wind-powered device to lift maximum weight. Tests understanding of aerodynamics, mechanical advantage, and energy conversion.

name: Research Science Institute (RSI) at MIT
description: Most prestigious free summer research program for high school students worldwide. Six weeks at MIT conducting original research with mentors from MIT, Harvard, and other institutions. Highly selective program for top STEM students.
source: Center for Excellence in Education / MIT
stem_fields: All Sciences, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science

name: Columbia University Science Honors Program (SHP)
description: Academic year program for NYC-area high school students. Saturday morning classes and research seminars in science and mathematics. Taught by Columbia faculty. Students engage with cutting-edge research topics.
stem_fields: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, Computer Science, Earth Science

name: Polygence Research Academy - Virtual Mentorship
description: One-on-one virtual research mentorship connecting high school students with PhD mentors. Students design and complete independent research projects over 10-16 weeks. Flexible scheduling and broad research topics available.
stem_fields: All Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Social Sciences

name: Simons Summer Research Program at Stony Brook
description: Seven-week paid research internship at Stony Brook University. Students work closely with faculty mentors on cutting-edge research in science, math, or engineering. Weekly stipend provided. Program culminates in research symposium.
stem_fields: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering

name: Johns Hopkins University Research Internship
description: Summer research program pairing high school students with JHU faculty. Work in biomedical, engineering, or science labs. Gain hands-on research experience and learn about academic careers. Program includes weekly seminars.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Medicine

name: Garcia Center for Polymers at Engineered Interfaces - Summer Research
description: Seven-week residential research program at Stony Brook for high school students. Focus on materials science and polymer research. Students design and conduct experiments with mentorship from faculty and graduate students.

name: Rockefeller University Summer Science Research Program (SSRP)
description: Paid summer research internship at prestigious research institution. High school students work full-time in labs alongside scientists. Weekly seminars, career guidance, and end-of-summer research presentations. Highly competitive.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Biology, Biochemistry, Genetics, Neuroscience

name: Broad Summer Scholars Program (BSSP)
description: Five-week paid summer research program at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard. Students conduct genomics and biomedical research. Professional development workshops, college prep, and mentorship from leading scientists.
stem_fields: Genomics, Computational Biology, Biomedical Research, Genetics

name: NASA SEES (STEM Enhancement in Earth Science) Virtual Internship
description: Free virtual summer internship focused on Earth science research. Students work with NASA scientists on real research projects. Weekly webinars, online collaboration, and final presentations. No travel required.
stem_fields: Earth Science, Climate Science, Environmental Science, Remote Sensing

name: Veritas Research Scholars Program
description: Year-long virtual research mentorship program. Students work one-on-one with PhD mentors to complete independent research projects. Flexible scheduling, comprehensive research training, and support through publication/competition submission.
stem_fields: All Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Social Sciences

name: UCSF High School Intern Program
description: Eight-week summer research internship for Bay Area high school students. Work in biomedical research labs at UCSF. Stipend provided. Weekly seminars on research skills, college prep, and career exploration in health sciences.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Biology, Medicine, Health Sciences, Neuroscience

name: Stanford Institutes of Medicine Summer Research Program (SIMR)
description: Eight-week residential research program at Stanford for high school students. Work in biomedical and clinical research labs. Housing provided, weekly seminars, and end-of-summer research symposium. Highly competitive.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Biology, Medicine, Genetics, Neuroscience

name: Yale Science & Engineering Association (YSEA) Research Apprenticeship
description: Summer research program placing Connecticut high school students in Yale research labs. Work with faculty on active research projects. Stipend provided. Focus on increasing diversity in STEM research careers.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Environmental Science

name: Boston University Research in Science & Engineering (RISE) Program
description: Six-week summer research internship for high school students. Work in BU labs on active research projects. Weekly professional development workshops. Program includes college credit option and stipend.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics

name: NIH High School Scientific Training and Enrichment Program (HiSTEP)
description: Year-long research program for DC-area high school students. After-school and summer components. Work in NIH labs on biomedical research. Mentorship from NIH scientists, college prep support, and stipend.
stem_fields: Biomedical Research, Biology, Medicine, Health Sciences, Genetics

name: MIT MOSTEC - MIT Online Science, Technology, and Engineering Community
description: Free six-month online program for underrepresented students. STEM instruction, research project with MIT mentor, college prep, and community building. Virtual format accessible nationwide. Culminates in final project presentation.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Computer Science

name: UC Davis Young Scholars Program (YSP)
description: Free six-week residential research program for California high school students. Students conduct independent research projects with UC Davis faculty mentors. All expenses covered including housing, meals, and materials.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Environmental Science, Computer Science

name: Carnegie Mellon SAMS Research Component
description: Part of Summer Academy for Math and Science program. Students conduct independent research projects with CMU faculty. Focus on STEM research skills, college prep, and building research portfolio. Fully-funded for selected students.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physical Sciences, Life Sciences

name: Jackson Laboratory Summer Student Program
description: Ten-week paid research internship at JAX labs in Maine. Students work on genetics and genomics research projects. Housing provided, weekly seminars, social activities, and final research symposium. Competitive program.
stem_fields: Genetics, Genomics, Biomedical Research, Computational Biology

name: Research Mentorship Program (RMP) - Virtual
description: Semester-long virtual research mentorship connecting students with university researchers. Structured curriculum teaching research methods, weekly meetings with mentor, and final research presentation. Accessible nationwide.
stem_fields: All Sciences, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science

name: Caltech SURF - High School Component
description: Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship program with limited spots for exceptional high school students. Ten-week paid research at Caltech. Work with faculty on cutting-edge projects. Stipend, housing, and travel allowance provided.
stem_fields: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics

name: Princeton University Laboratory Learning Program
description: Academic year research program for New Jersey high school students. Students work in Princeton labs 2-3 afternoons per week. Hands-on research experience, mentorship, and college application support. Free program.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Neuroscience

name: Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center High School Internship
description: Eight-week summer research internship for Seattle-area students. Work in cancer research labs at Fred Hutch. Stipend provided. Weekly seminars on cancer biology, research careers, and professional development.
stem_fields: Cancer Biology, Biomedical Research, Genetics, Immunology

name: Duke University Talent Identification Program (TIP) Research Scholars
description: Summer research program connecting high school students with Duke researchers. Three-week intensive research experience. Projects span sciences, engineering, and mathematics. Residential program with mentorship and seminars.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Environmental Science

name: Michigan State University High School Honors Science Program (HSHSP)
description: Seven-week residential research program for high school students. Conduct independent research with MSU faculty. Includes research training, college courses, social activities, and final symposium. Highly competitive.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics

name: SplashLearn Math - Pre-Kindergarten
description: Game-based PreK math program covering counting 1-10, number recognition, basic shapes, colors, patterns, and comparisons. Interactive games and activities designed for early learners. Free and premium content available.

name: SplashLearn Math - Kindergarten
description: Kindergarten math games covering counting to 20, addition and subtraction basics, place value, measurement, shapes, and data. Aligned to Common Core standards with engaging characters and rewards.

name: SplashLearn Math - 1st Grade
description: First grade math curriculum with 350+ games. Addition and subtraction within 20, place value to 100, measurement, time, money, and geometry. Personalized learning paths adapt to student progress.

name: SplashLearn Math - 2nd Grade
description: Second grade math with 400+ interactive games. Addition and subtraction within 100, place value to 1000, multiplication foundations, measurement, time, money, and data. Real-time progress tracking.

name: SplashLearn Math - 3rd Grade
description: Third grade math featuring 450+ games. Multiplication and division, fractions, area and perimeter, time, measurement, and data analysis. Adaptive difficulty adjusts to student mastery level.

name: SplashLearn Math - 4th Grade
description: Fourth grade math with 500+ engaging games. Multi-digit multiplication and division, fractions and decimals, measurement conversions, geometry, and data interpretation. Standards-aligned curriculum.

name: SplashLearn Math - 5th Grade
description: Fifth grade math curriculum with 550+ games. Decimal operations, fraction operations, volume, coordinate planes, and algebraic thinking. Prepares students for middle school mathematics.

name: SplashLearn Reading - Pre-Kindergarten
description: PreK reading program introducing letter recognition, phonics basics, sight words, and pre-reading skills. Interactive stories and activities build early literacy foundation through play.

name: SplashLearn Reading - Kindergarten
description: Kindergarten reading curriculum with phonics, sight words, letter sounds, simple sentences, and reading comprehension. Engaging stories and games develop foundational reading skills.

name: SplashLearn Reading - 1st Grade
description: First grade reading program covering phonics rules, sight words, vocabulary development, reading fluency, and comprehension strategies. Interactive leveled readers with comprehension questions.

name: SplashLearn Reading - 2nd Grade
description: Second grade reading with advanced phonics, vocabulary expansion, reading comprehension, and writing basics. Diverse texts including fiction, nonfiction, and poetry with skill-building activities.

name: SplashLearn Reading - 3rd Grade
description: Third grade reading focusing on fluency, comprehension strategies, literary analysis, vocabulary development, and grammar. Complex texts with higher-level thinking questions.

name: SplashLearn Parent Dashboard
description: Comprehensive parent dashboard with real-time progress tracking, skill mastery reports, time spent learning, and personalized recommendations. Monitor child learning and identify areas for improvement.

name: SplashLearn Rewards and Motivation System
description: Gamification features with virtual coins, pet customization, rewards, and achievement badges. Motivate children to practice regularly through engaging game mechanics and personalized avatars.

name: SplashLearn Adaptive Learning Engine
description: AI-powered adaptive learning technology that personalizes difficulty, pacing, and content based on individual student performance. Identifies knowledge gaps and provides targeted practice for mastery.

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Astrophysics at New Mexico Tech
description: 39-day residential research program for rising 10th and 11th graders at New Mexico Institute of Mining and Technology. Students conduct hands-on astrophysics research using university telescopes to track and model near-Earth asteroids. Learn orbital mechanics, computer programming, and observational astronomy. Work in teams to collect telescope data, perform astrometric analysis, and determine asteroid orbits. Complete independent research project with scientific paper and presentation. College-level coursework taught by experienced faculty. Build lifelong friendships with peers from around the world. Highly selective admissions based on academics and passion for science.
stem_fields: Astrophysics, Astronomy, Physics, Computer Science, Orbital Mechanics

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Astrophysics at University of Colorado Boulder
description: 39-day residential research program for rising 10th and 11th graders at CU Boulder. Students conduct cutting-edge astrophysics research studying asteroids and celestial mechanics. Use Sommers-Bausch Observatory to observe near-Earth objects. Learn data analysis, Python programming, and scientific methodology. Collaborative team-based research with individual project components. Write formal research paper following scientific publication standards. Access to university facilities and resources. Campus life in beautiful Boulder, Colorado. Daily lectures, problem sets, and research activities. Preparation for college-level science coursework.
stem_fields: Astrophysics, Astronomy, Physics, Computer Science, Data Analysis

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Astrophysics at Purdue University
description: 39-day residential research program for rising 10th and 11th graders at Purdue University. Students engage in authentic astrophysics research studying asteroid orbital dynamics. Collect and analyze astronomical data using university observatory. Learn computational methods for celestial mechanics. Balance theoretical coursework with hands-on research. Develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Work collaboratively while pursuing individual research questions. Experience college campus life at major research university. Build portfolio of work including research paper and presentation.
stem_fields: Astrophysics, Astronomy, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Programming

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Biochemistry at Purdue University
description: 39-day residential research program for rising 10th and 11th graders exploring biochemistry and molecular biology at Purdue University. Students investigate enzyme kinetics, protein structure and function, and genetic engineering. Hands-on laboratory work with modern biochemistry techniques. Learn molecular biology methods including PCR, gel electrophoresis, and spectrophotometry. Design and conduct independent research experiments. Analyze biochemical data using computational tools. Write formal scientific research paper. Lectures covering biochemistry fundamentals and current research. Preparation for college-level life sciences.
stem_fields: Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Genetics, Laboratory Science, Protein Chemistry

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Biochemistry at Indiana University
description: 39-day residential research program for rising 10th and 11th graders at Indiana University Bloomington. Students explore frontiers of biochemistry through hands-on research and coursework. Study protein biochemistry, enzyme mechanisms, and metabolic pathways. Laboratory techniques including chromatography, spectrometry, and bioinformatics analysis. Team-based research projects addressing real scientific questions. Individual components allowing personal research interests. Scientific writing and presentation skills development. Access to IU research facilities and faculty mentorship. Immersive residential experience with diverse cohort of science-minded students.
stem_fields: Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, Laboratory Techniques, Enzymology

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Genomics at Purdue University
description: 39-day residential research program for rising 10th and 11th graders focused on genomics and bioinformatics. Students analyze genomic data, study gene expression, and explore computational biology. Learn DNA sequencing technologies, genetic variation analysis, and evolutionary genomics. Hands-on work with bioinformatics software and databases. Programming for biological data analysis. Research projects investigating genetic questions using real genomic datasets. Understanding personalized medicine and precision health. Interdisciplinary approach combining biology, computer science, and statistics.
stem_fields: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Genetics, Computational Biology, Data Science

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Application Process and Admissions
description: Highly selective admissions process for motivated students passionate about science. Application includes academic transcripts, standardized test scores, essays, and recommendations. Strong background in math and science required. Selection based on academic achievement, intellectual curiosity, and commitment to research. No prior research experience necessary. Holistic review considering diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Rolling admissions with February deadline. Interview may be required for finalists. Focus on identifying students who will thrive in intensive research environment.

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Financial Aid and Accessibility
description: Comprehensive financial aid program ensuring talented students from all economic backgrounds can attend. Need-based financial aid covering tuition, room, and board. Travel assistance available for students requiring support. No student denied admission due to financial need. Application fee waivers for qualifying students. Commitment to socioeconomic diversity. Support for first-generation college students and underrepresented groups in STEM. Making elite science education accessible regardless of family income. Transparent financial aid process with clear guidelines.

name: Summer Science Program (SSP) - Alumni Network and College Success
description: Join elite network of SSP alumni attending top universities worldwide. SSP experience highly valued by college admissions officers. Alumni community includes scientists, engineers, entrepreneurs, and leaders across fields. Networking opportunities and mentorship from past participants. Strong track record of alumni success in STEM careers. College application support leveraging SSP research experience. Many alumni cite SSP as transformative experience shaping career path. Lifelong connections with fellow alumni. Annual reunions and alumni events.
stem_fields: Alumni Network, College Preparation, Career Development, Mentorship

name: SWE - High School Scholarship Program
description: Annual scholarship for female high school seniors planning to pursue ABET-accredited engineering programs. Awards range from $1,000-$5,000 based on academic achievement, leadership, and commitment to engineering. Multiple scholarships available.

name: SWE - SWENext Club Program
description: Year-round club program for middle and high school girls interested in engineering. Clubs meet regularly to explore engineering through projects, guest speakers, field trips, and competitions. Access to SWE mentors and resources.

name: SWE - Engineering Design Competition for High School
description: Annual engineering design competition where teams of high school girls solve real-world engineering challenges. Teams design, build, and present solutions. Includes mentorship from professional engineers and cash prizes.
stem_fields: Engineering, Design, Problem Solving, All Engineering Fields

name: SWE - Summer Engineering Camp for Girls
description: Week-long residential summer camp for high school girls to explore engineering fields. Hands-on projects, lab tours, college campus visits, and mentorship from women engineers. Includes all meals and housing.

name: SWE - Collegiate Section Mentorship Program for HS Students
description: Mentorship program connecting high school girls with women engineering students and professionals. Monthly meetings, career guidance, college prep support, and networking opportunities.
stem_fields: Engineering, Career Development, All Engineering Fields

name: SWE - WE Local Conference High School Track
description: Day-long conference for high school girls at regional SWE conferences. Attend workshops, hear from women engineers, participate in hands-on activities, and network with role models.

name: SWE - Engineering Exploration Day
description: Free one-day event for middle and high school girls to explore engineering through hands-on activities, lab tours, and interactions with women engineers. Hosted at universities and companies nationwide.

name: SWE - Invent It. Build It. Competition
description: National competition for high school teams to invent and build engineering solutions to societal challenges. Teams receive mentorship, present at regional events, and winners compete nationally.

name: SWE - Virtual Career Exploration Series for High School
description: Monthly virtual events featuring women engineers from various industries. Learn about engineering careers, ask questions, and explore different engineering paths. Free and accessible nationwide.
stem_fields: Engineering, Career Exploration, All Engineering Fields

name: SWE - Engineering Leadership Institute for High School Girls
description: Multi-day residential program focused on engineering leadership skills for high school girls. Workshops on teamwork, communication, project management, and engineering ethics. Includes college prep guidance.

name: SWE - College Preparation Workshops for Engineering
description: Series of workshops helping high school girls prepare for engineering college applications. Topics include essay writing, college selection, financial aid, and scholarship applications.

name: SWE - Engineering Innovation Showcase
description: Annual showcase where high school girls present engineering projects to judges, peers, and industry professionals. Opportunity to demonstrate skills, receive feedback, and win recognition awards.

name: SWE - Women of Color in Engineering Scholarship
description: $2,500 scholarship specifically for Black, Hispanic, and Native American female high school seniors pursuing engineering. Emphasizes diversity and inclusion in engineering fields.

name: SWE - First Generation Scholar in Engineering Program
description: $3,000 scholarship and mentorship program for first-generation college-bound female students pursuing engineering. Includes year-long mentorship from SWE professional members.

name: SWE - Engineering Ambassador Program for High School
description: Program training high school girls to become engineering ambassadors in their communities. Lead outreach, organize events, and inspire younger students. Includes leadership training and SWE certification.

name: SWE - Code It! Programming Competition for Girls
description: Programming competition for high school girls to solve coding challenges and build software projects. Beginner and advanced divisions. Includes workshops and mentorship from women software engineers.
stem_fields: Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Programming, Computer Science

name: SWE - Engineering Internship Connection Program
description: Program connecting high school girls with summer engineering internships at companies and research labs. Application support, interview prep, and mentor matching included.

name: SWE - STEM Outreach Volunteer Leadership Program
description: High school girls organize and lead STEM outreach activities for elementary and middle school students. Develop leadership skills while promoting engineering to younger girls.

name: SWE - Engineering for Social Good Challenge
description: Competition where high school teams develop engineering solutions to address social issues like clean water, renewable energy, or healthcare access. Winning teams receive funding to implement projects.

name: SWE - Engineering Portfolio Development Workshop
description: Workshop series teaching high school girls to build professional engineering portfolios showcasing projects, skills, and achievements. Includes resume writing, GitHub setup, and presentation skills.

name: SWE - Annual Conference High School Registration
description: Discounted registration for high school girls to attend the annual SWE Conference, largest conference for women in engineering. Access to career fair, workshops, and networking with 15,000+ attendees.
stem_fields: Engineering, Career Development, All Engineering Fields

name: TASP - Telluride Association Summer Program for Juniors
description: Fully-funded 6-week residential summer program for rising high school juniors. Intensive seminar-based education exploring diverse topics from humanities to sciences. Small cohorts of 15-20 students engage in critical reading, discussion, and writing. Held at university campuses nationwide. Covers all costs including travel, tuition, room, board, and books. Highly selective program emphasizing intellectual curiosity, community, and self-governance. Application requires essays demonstrating analytical thinking.

name: TASS - Telluride Association Sophomore Seminars
description: Fully-funded 6-week summer program for rising high school sophomores. Focus on African American history, culture, and social issues. Small seminar format with 15-20 students exploring race, identity, and justice. Residential program at university campuses. All expenses covered including travel, tuition, room, and board. Emphasizes community building, critical dialogue, and leadership development. Students read primary sources, participate in discussions, and develop writing skills. Highly selective admission process.
stem_fields: Social Sciences, History, African American Studies, Critical Thinking

name: TASP - Science and Mathematics Seminar
description: TASP seminar focusing on STEM topics including mathematics, physics, biology, or computer science. Explore cutting-edge scientific research and theoretical concepts. Develop scientific reasoning, problem-solving, and research skills. Read scientific papers, conduct analyses, and engage in collaborative inquiry. Part of fully-funded 6-week residential program. Students selected based on intellectual curiosity and analytical ability.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Computer Science, Research

name: TASP - Philosophy and Critical Theory Seminar
description: TASP seminar exploring philosophical questions and critical theory. Study ethics, epistemology, political philosophy, or contemporary theory. Develop rigorous analytical and argumentative skills. Read primary philosophical texts and engage in Socratic dialogue. Fully-funded 6-week program with all expenses covered.

name: TASP - Literature and Creative Writing Seminar
description: TASP seminar examining literature, literary criticism, and creative writing. Analyze diverse texts, develop close reading skills, and create original writing. Explore narrative, poetry, and experimental forms. Fully-funded program fostering intellectual community.

name: TASP - Social Sciences and Policy Seminar
description: TASP seminar investigating social issues, public policy, economics, or political science. Analyze social structures, power dynamics, and policy solutions. Develop research and advocacy skills. Fully-funded residential program.
stem_fields: Social Sciences, Political Science, Economics, Policy

name: TASP - Environmental Studies and Sustainability Seminar
description: TASP seminar exploring environmental science, climate change, conservation, and sustainability. Examine ecological systems, environmental policy, and human impacts. Develop environmental literacy and systems thinking. Fully-funded 6-week program.
stem_fields: Environmental Science, Ecology, Sustainability, Climate Science

name: TASS - Race, Identity, and Social Justice Seminar
description: TASS seminar centered on African American experiences and racial justice. Examine historical and contemporary issues of race, identity, power, and activism. Read works by Black scholars, writers, and activists. Develop critical consciousness and leadership. Fully-funded program for sophomores.
stem_fields: African American Studies, Sociology, Social Justice, History

name: TASP/TASS - Alumni Network and College Support
description: Lifelong network of TASP and TASS alumni providing mentorship, college guidance, and career support. Access to Telluride Association community, chapters at universities, and professional connections. Alumni events and reunions. Continued intellectual engagement after summer program.

name: Google Computer Science Summer Institute (CSSI)
description: Intensive 4-week summer program for graduating high school seniors interested in computer science. Students learn programming fundamentals, build projects, and connect with Google engineers. Program includes hands-on coding, group projects, and exposure to industry professionals. Fully funded with stipend.

name: Microsoft High School Discovery Program
description: Week-long workshop for high school students to explore computer science and technology careers at Microsoft. Students participate in coding workshops, meet Microsoft engineers, tour facilities, and work on technology projects. Focus on students from underrepresented communities.

name: Amazon Future Engineer Summer Internship
description: Paid summer internship for high school students interested in software engineering and computer science. Students work on real Amazon projects, receive mentorship from Amazon engineers, and participate in professional development workshops. Stipend provided.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Computer Science, Cloud Computing

name: Meta University for High School Students
description: Engineering-focused program for high school students from underrepresented communities. Students learn software engineering fundamentals, work on projects, and receive mentorship from Meta engineers. Program includes technical training and career development.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mobile Development

name: Apple Pathways Alliance Program
description: Year-round program for high school students from underrepresented communities interested in technology careers. Includes summer internship component where students work on real Apple projects, receive mentorship, and participate in professional development workshops.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Computer Science

name: IBM Accelerate Program for High School
