description: Virtual 8-week summer program teaching high school students professional software development skills. Students learn agile methodology, design thinking, and build projects using IBM technologies. Includes mentorship from IBM professionals.
stem_fields: Software Development, Computer Science, Data Science, AI

name: Salesforce Futureforce Tech Launchpad
description: Multi-week program for high school students exploring software engineering and technology careers. Students learn coding, participate in workshops, and work on projects. Strong focus on students from underrepresented backgrounds in tech.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Cloud Computing, Computer Science

name: Intel Student Honor Research Program
description: Research internship for high school students interested in computer science, engineering, and technology. Students work alongside Intel researchers on cutting-edge projects in AI, chip design, and software development.
stem_fields: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, AI, Hardware Design
regional_availability: Santa Clara, CA and other locations

name: Adobe Digital Academy - High School Track
description: Program introducing high school students to digital design, user experience, and front-end development. Students learn Adobe Creative Suite, design principles, and web development while working on real projects.
stem_fields: Web Development, UX Design, Computer Science, Digital Media

name: Twitter #EarlyBird Engineering Program
description: Summer program for high school students from underrepresented backgrounds interested in software engineering. Students learn coding, work on projects, and receive mentorship from Twitter engineers. Includes workshops on career development.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mobile Development

name: LinkedIn REACH Apprenticeship Program
description: Apprenticeship program for graduating high school seniors interested in software engineering careers. Students receive training in programming, work on LinkedIn projects, and transition into full-time roles or college with strong industry experience.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Computer Science, Web Development

name: Dropbox Launch Program for High School
description: Summer internship program for high school students interested in software engineering and product development. Students work on real Dropbox projects, receive mentorship, and learn about tech industry careers.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Computer Science, Product Development

name: Cisco ThingQbator for Young Innovators
description: IoT-focused program for high school students interested in Internet of Things, networking, and hardware/software integration. Students build IoT projects, learn networking fundamentals, and receive mentorship from Cisco engineers.
stem_fields: Internet of Things, Networking, Computer Science, Hardware

name: Netflix Pathways Program - High School Edition
description: Entertainment technology internship for high school students interested in software engineering, data science, and content technology. Students work on Netflix technology projects and learn about streaming, algorithms, and user experience.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Content Technology

name: Snap Inc. Academy - High School Track
description: AR/VR and mobile development program for high school students. Students learn augmented reality development, mobile app creation, and work on Snapchat-related projects. Focus on creative technology and innovation.
stem_fields: Augmented Reality, Mobile Development, Computer Science, Computer Graphics

name: Uber Elevate - High School Engineering Experience
description: Engineering internship for high school students interested in transportation technology, mapping, and software development. Students work on Uber technology projects, learn about ride-sharing algorithms, and receive industry mentorship.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Mapping Technology

name: Airbnb Connect - High School Engineering Program
description: Summer program for high school students from underrepresented backgrounds interested in software engineering and product design. Students learn full-stack development, work on Airbnb projects, and build professional networks in tech.
stem_fields: Software Engineering, Full-Stack Development, Product Design

name: GitHub Education - Student Developer Program
description: Virtual program for high school students learning software development and open source contribution. Students learn Git, GitHub, collaborative coding, and contribute to open source projects. Includes mentorship from GitHub developers.
stem_fields: Software Development, Computer Science, Open Source, Version Control

name: Tinkercad - Introduction to 3D Design
description: Beginner 3D design course teaching basic shapes, manipulation, and construction. Learn to create simple 3D models using browser-based CAD software. Build foundation for engineering and design thinking.

name: Tinkercad - Name Tag Design
description: Create personalized 3D name tags using text and shape tools. Learn extrusion, alignment, and grouping. Perfect beginner project introducing core CAD concepts through practical application.

name: Tinkercad - House Design Project
description: Design 3D house model using architectural principles. Learn walls, roofs, windows, and interior spaces. Apply mathematical concepts of scale, proportion, and spatial reasoning.

name: Tinkercad - Keychain Design
description: Create custom keychain designs for 3D printing. Learn design constraints, practical tolerances, and preparing models for manufacturing. Introduction to additive manufacturing concepts.

name: Tinkercad - Robot Character Design
description: Design creative robot characters using geometric shapes. Learn character design principles, proportions, and creative modeling. Combine engineering concepts with artistic expression.

name: Tinkercad - Castle Design
description: Build medieval castle with towers, walls, and architectural features. Learn symmetry, duplication, and complex assembly. Historical architecture meets CAD skills.

name: Tinkercad - Jewelry Design
description: Design rings, pendants, and bracelets for 3D printing. Learn precision modeling, measurement, and wearable design constraints. Practical application of geometry and aesthetics.

name: Tinkercad - Mechanical Gears Design
description: Design interlocking gears and mechanical systems. Learn gear ratios, teeth spacing, and mechanical advantage. Engineering principles through functional 3D design.

name: Tinkercad - Box Design for 3D Printing
description: Create functional boxes with lids and hinges. Learn assembly design, tolerances, and print-in-place mechanisms. Practical design for everyday objects.

name: Tinkercad - Minecraft Character Design
description: Create Minecraft-style blocky characters and structures. Voxel-based design principles and pixel art translation to 3D. Engage game design enthusiasts in CAD.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - LED Blink Basics
description: Introduction to electronics with simple LED circuit. Learn breadboards, resistors, and basic Arduino programming. Foundation for all circuit projects.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - Traffic Light System
description: Build Arduino-controlled traffic light with timed sequences. Learn programming logic, state machines, and real-world system modeling. Practical electronics application.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - Distance Sensor Project
description: Use ultrasonic sensor to measure distance with Arduino. Learn sensor integration, data processing, and conditional logic. Introduction to robotics sensing.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - Piano with Buzzer
description: Create musical piano using buttons and piezo buzzer. Learn frequency, sound generation, and user input. Combine music and electronics.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - Temperature Monitor
description: Build temperature sensing system with display. Learn analog sensors, temperature conversion, and data display. Environmental monitoring application.
stem_fields: Electronics, Sensors, Data Science, Environmental Science

name: Tinkercad Circuits - Servo Motor Control
description: Control servo motors with Arduino for robotic movement. Learn PWM signals, angle control, and automation. Foundation for robotics projects.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - RGB LED Color Mixer
description: Create color-mixing project with RGB LED and potentiometers. Learn color theory, analog input, and PWM control. Art meets electronics.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - Motion Detector Alarm
description: Build security system with PIR motion sensor and alarm. Learn digital sensors, interrupt handling, and security system design. Real-world application.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - LCD Display Project
description: Display text and data on LCD screen with Arduino. Learn parallel communication, character displays, and user interface design. Essential output device.

name: Tinkercad Circuits - Photoresistor Night Light
description: Create automatic night light using light sensor. Learn analog sensors, threshold detection, and automation. Practical home automation project.

name: Tinkercad Codeblocks - Introduction to Coding
description: Learn programming basics through visual block coding. Create 3D designs using code instead of mouse. Introduction to computational thinking and algorithms.

name: Tinkercad Codeblocks - Loops and Patterns
description: Use loops to create repeating patterns in 3D. Learn iteration, variables, and efficiency. Programming fundamentals through visual design.

name: Tinkercad Codeblocks - Parametric Design
description: Create designs that change based on parameters and variables. Learn functions, parameters, and modular design. Advanced programming concepts through CAD.

name: Tinkercad Community Gallery
description: Explore millions of shared designs, remix and learn from community. Discover projects, get inspired, and share creations. Collaborative learning platform.

name: The Knowledge Society (TKS) - Core Innovate Program
description: 10-month immersive program for teens ages 13-17 learning emerging technologies and innovation skills. Students explore AI, biotechnology, quantum computing, blockchain, and other exponential technologies. Project-based learning with real-world applications. Build portfolio of innovative projects. Weekly sessions with industry mentors from leading tech companies. Develop entrepreneurial mindset and problem-solving skills. Global community of ambitious teen innovators. Virtual program accessible worldwide. Focus on technologies shaping the future. Selective admissions process.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Biotechnology, Quantum Computing, Blockchain, Emerging Technologies

name: TKS - Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Focus
description: Deep dive into AI and machine learning within TKS program. Learn neural networks, computer vision, natural language processing, and AI ethics. Build AI-powered applications and models. Work on real-world AI challenges. Access to industry-standard tools and platforms. Projects applying AI to healthcare, education, climate, and social impact. Mentorship from AI researchers and practitioners. Understanding both technical fundamentals and societal implications of AI.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Neural Networks, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing

name: TKS - Biotechnology and Health Innovation Focus
description: Explore cutting-edge biotechnology and health tech within TKS program. Learn genetic engineering, CRISPR, synthetic biology, and personalized medicine. Understand drug discovery, medical devices, and biotech entrepreneurship. Projects addressing global health challenges. Study intersection of biology, technology, and medicine. Access to biotech industry mentors and resources. Ethical considerations in biotechnology. Future of healthcare and longevity research.
stem_fields: Biotechnology, Genetic Engineering, CRISPR, Synthetic Biology, Health Tech

name: TKS - Emerging Technologies and Innovation Track
description: Comprehensive exploration of exponential technologies shaping the future. Study quantum computing, blockchain, virtual/augmented reality, space technology, and advanced robotics. Learn how technologies converge to solve complex problems. Build interdisciplinary projects combining multiple tech domains. Develop systems thinking and futures literacy. Understanding exponential growth and technological disruption. Access to diverse range of industry experts across tech sectors.
stem_fields: Quantum Computing, Blockchain, Virtual Reality, Space Technology, Robotics, Emerging Tech

name: TKS - Innovation Challenges and Project Portfolio
description: Monthly innovation challenges applying learned technologies to real-world problems. Students identify problems, research solutions, and build prototypes. Develop portfolio showcasing 8-10 projects across different technologies. Presentation and pitching skills through project showcases. Peer feedback and collaborative learning. Projects can focus on social impact, entrepreneurship, or pure innovation. Build tangible evidence of skills for college applications and future opportunities.
stem_fields: Innovation, Problem Solving, Project-Based Learning, Entrepreneurship

name: TKS - Global Teen Innovator Community
description: Join worldwide network of ambitious teen innovators and future leaders. Collaborative learning environment with peers across 30+ countries. Virtual meetups, study groups, and peer mentorship. Alumni network of TKS graduates at top universities and tech companies. Connections with like-minded teens passionate about technology and impact. Lifelong friendships and professional network starting in high school. Community support and accountability throughout program.

name: TKS - Industry Mentorship and Expert Sessions
description: Weekly sessions with industry experts from Google, Microsoft, SpaceX, and leading biotech companies. Learn directly from innovators, entrepreneurs, and researchers at forefront of technology. Ask questions and get career guidance from professionals. Exposure to diverse career paths in emerging tech. Understanding real-world applications of technologies. Networking opportunities with industry leaders. Mentors provide feedback on student projects and ideas.
stem_fields: Mentorship, Career Development, Industry Connections, Professional Skills

name: TKS - Scholarship and Financial Aid Program
description: Need-based and merit-based scholarships available for talented students from all backgrounds. Partial and full scholarships reducing financial barriers. Application process considering academic achievement, passion for innovation, and financial need. Commitment to diversity and inclusion in tech education. Making emerging technology education accessible to underrepresented students. Flexible payment plans also available. Focus on potential and drive over ability to pay.

name: TypingClub - Beginner Typing Course
description: Complete beginner typing curriculum teaching home row, proper finger placement, and basic keyboarding. 600+ lessons with games and exercises. K-12 students learn touch typing from scratch. Free access with optional premium features.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Digital Literacy, Keyboarding

name: TypingClub - Home Row Mastery
description: Foundation lessons focusing on ASDF and JKL; home row keys. Learn proper finger positioning and muscle memory development. Interactive feedback on accuracy and speed. Essential first step for touch typing.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Keyboarding, Motor Skills

name: TypingClub - Top Row Keys (QWERTY)
description: Expand typing skills to top row including Q, W, E, R, T, Y, U, I, O, P. Progressive lessons building on home row foundation. Increase speed while maintaining accuracy. Games reinforce learning.

name: TypingClub - Bottom Row Keys (ZXCVBNM)
description: Master bottom row letters completing full alphabet coverage. Practice finger stretching and coordination. Combine all letter rows for full keyboard proficiency. Achieve 20+ WPM typing speed.

name: TypingClub - Capital Letters and Shift Keys
description: Learn proper shift key technique for capital letters. Practice both left and right shift keys. Develop capitalization habits for proper writing. Maintain speed while adding shift functionality.

name: TypingClub - Numbers and Number Row
description: Add number typing to keyboard repertoire. Practice number row keys 1-0 with proper finger placement. Essential for data entry and mathematical typing. Reach 25+ WPM with numbers.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Keyboarding, Data Entry

name: TypingClub - Punctuation and Symbols
description: Master punctuation marks including periods, commas, apostrophes, and quotation marks. Practice special symbols like @, #, $, %. Complete keyboard proficiency for writing and coding.

name: TypingClub - Speed Building Exercises
description: Increase typing speed through timed drills and exercises. Set personal WPM goals and track improvement. Practice common words and phrases. Achieve 30-40 WPM for functional typing.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Keyboarding, Speed Training

name: TypingClub - Accuracy Improvement
description: Focus on typing accuracy and error reduction. Learn to type without looking at keyboard. Develop muscle memory and proper technique. Maintain 95%+ accuracy at comfortable speeds.

name: TypingClub - Typing Games
description: Game-based typing practice with interactive challenges. Race cars, pop balloons, and complete missions while typing. Engaging reinforcement of typing skills. Suitable for all ages and skill levels.

name: TypingClub - Advanced Typing Course
description: Advanced lessons for experienced typists. Practice complex texts, technical writing, and coding. Reach 50+ WPM with high accuracy. Professional-level keyboarding skills.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Keyboarding, Professional Skills

name: TypingClub - Typing Tests and Assessments
description: Standardized typing tests measuring WPM and accuracy. Benchmark progress and earn certificates. Track improvement over time. Prepare for typing requirements in school and work.

name: TypingClub - Coding Typing Practice
description: Specialized lessons for typing code with proper formatting. Practice common programming symbols, brackets, and syntax. Develop speed with special characters for computer science.

name: TypingClub - Student Progress Dashboard
description: Track typing progress with detailed analytics. View WPM improvement graphs, accuracy trends, and lesson completion. Set personal goals and celebrate achievements. Free progress tracking for all users.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Data Literacy, Self-Monitoring

name: TypingClub - Multilingual Support
description: Typing lessons available in 30+ languages including Spanish, French, German, and more. Support English language learners and international students. Keyboard layout options for different languages.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Keyboarding, Language Support

name: TypingClub - Accessibility Features
description: Screen reader compatible and keyboard accessible interface. Support for students with disabilities including dyslexia and visual impairments. Adjustable fonts, colors, and lesson pacing. Inclusive design for all learners.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Accessibility, Inclusive Design

name: TypingClub - Premium Edition Features
description: Optional premium subscription adding advanced features. Remove ads, access premium games, unlock certificates, and get priority support. Schools and districts can upgrade for enhanced analytics. Core typing curriculum remains free.

name: TypingClub - Digital Citizenship Integration
description: Lessons integrating typing practice with digital citizenship concepts. Learn online safety, netiquette, and responsible technology use while improving keyboarding. Prepare for digital world.
stem_fields: Computer Skills, Technology, Digital Citizenship, Online Safety

name: MIT THINK Scholars Program
description: Year-long research mentorship program connecting high school students with MIT graduate student mentors. Students propose and execute original research projects in any STEM field. Virtual mentorship with monthly meetings and project guidance. Culminates in research presentation at MIT. Free program supporting independent student research.
stem_fields: All STEM Fields, Independent Research, Scientific Method

name: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Studies - Online High School
description: Part-time online courses and mentorship from Stanford faculty and graduate students. STEM courses with small class sizes and individualized attention. Students engage in project-based learning with mentorship. Flexible scheduling for advanced high school students. Financial aid available.

name: Caltech Student-Faculty Programs
description: Summer research mentorship connecting high school students with Caltech faculty labs. Students work on cutting-edge research projects in physics, chemistry, biology, or engineering. Full-time summer commitment with stipend. Highly competitive admissions emphasizing academic excellence.

name: Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth (CTY) Online
description: Advanced online STEM courses with instructor mentorship for gifted students. Small class sizes with personalized feedback and guidance. Courses in mathematics, computer science, and sciences. Year-round enrollment with flexible pacing.
stem_fields: Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Biology, Chemistry

name: UC Berkeley BITES (Bioengineering Institute of Technology and Engineering for Students)
description: Free mentorship program pairing high school students with UC Berkeley bioengineering researchers. Students learn laboratory techniques, conduct research, and present findings. Year-long commitment with weekly meetings. Focus on underrepresented students in STEM.

name: Carnegie Mellon AI Scholars Program
description: Virtual mentorship program teaching artificial intelligence and machine learning to high school students. Weekly online sessions with CMU faculty and graduate students. Hands-on projects applying AI to real-world problems. Free program with certificate upon completion.
stem_fields: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Data Science

name: Columbia Science Honors Program
description: Saturday enrichment program at Columbia University for high school students. Advanced STEM courses taught by Columbia faculty. Hands-on laboratories and research projects. Academic year program building college-level skills. Free to NYC metro area students.
stem_fields: Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science

name: University of Chicago Research in the Biological Sciences (RIBS)
description: Summer research program pairing students with UChicago biology faculty. Full-time laboratory research experience in molecular biology, genetics, or neuroscience. Students receive stipend and housing. Culminates in research symposium. Highly selective program.

name: Duke TIP Online Courses
description: Advanced online STEM courses with instructor mentorship. Small classes with personalized feedback and college-prep curriculum. Mathematics, computer science, and science courses. Self-paced and instructor-led options available.

name: VEX IQ Competition
description: Elementary and middle school robotics competition for ages 8-14. Teams design and build robots using VEX IQ system to compete in game-based challenges. Includes teamwork, robot skills, and STEM research project components.

name: VEX Robotics Competition (VRC)
description: High school robotics competition for ages 14-18. Teams build robots using VEX V5 system to compete in strategic game challenges. Features alliance matches, skills challenges, and design awards at local, regional, and world championship levels.

name: VEX IQ Cooperative Competition
description: Modified VEX IQ competition format emphasizing collaboration over competition. Teams work together to achieve common goals, promoting STEM learning and teamwork for younger students aged 6-11.

name: VEX Robotics World Championship
description: Premier international robotics competition bringing together top VEX teams from around the world. Features VEX IQ, VRC, and VEX U divisions with over 1,600 teams competing in Louisville, Kentucky.

name: VEX Robotics Skills Challenge
description: Individual team skills competition component of VEX competitions. Teams compete in driver skills and autonomous skills challenges to qualify for championship events and earn recognition.

name: VEX IQ STEM Research Project
description: Research component of VEX IQ competition where teams investigate real-world STEM problems related to the game theme. Teams present their findings to judges, developing presentation and research skills.

name: VEX Robotics Design Award Competition
description: Engineering design documentation and presentation competition within VEX events. Teams maintain engineering notebooks and present their design process to judges, emphasizing STEM learning over robot performance.

name: VEX Girls Powered Program
description: Initiative to encourage girls participation in VEX Robotics through mentorship, all-girls teams, and special recognition. Provides resources and support for female students in STEM robotics.

name: VEX Robotics Signature Events
description: Premium regional competitions with enhanced awards, recognition, and qualification opportunities for VEX Worlds. Features top-tier competition experience with additional STEM activities and networking.

name: Wonder Workshop - Dash Robot Introduction (K-2)
description: Beginner robotics curriculum for Dash robot. Learn basic programming through visual block coding, movement, sounds, and lights. No reading required interface perfect for early elementary.

name: Wonder Workshop - Dash Intermediate Programming (3-5)
description: Intermediate Dash curriculum teaching loops, events, variables, and conditionals. Build complex programs controlling robot behavior. CSTA standards-aligned computer science curriculum.
stem_fields: Robotics, Computer Science, Programming, Computational Thinking

name: Wonder Workshop - Cue Robot Advanced Programming (6-8)
description: Advanced robotics with Cue robot teaching JavaScript programming. Text-based coding, advanced sensors, and AI concepts. Prepare middle schoolers for high school computer science.
stem_fields: Robotics, JavaScript, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence

name: Wonder Workshop - Math with Dash (K-5)
description: Integrate mathematics concepts with robotics. Teach geometry, measurement, patterns, and problem-solving through Dash robot activities. STEM cross-curricular learning.

name: Wonder Workshop - Science Adventures with Dash (K-5)
description: Explore science concepts through robotics challenges. Physical science, engineering design, and scientific inquiry. Hands-on NGSS-aligned science curriculum.

name: Wonder Workshop - Storytelling with Dash (K-5)
description: Combine literacy and robotics through storytelling projects. Create interactive stories, character development, and narrative structure with robot animation. Arts integration.

name: Wonder Workshop - Blockly App
description: Visual block-based programming app for Dash and Dot robots. Drag-and-drop coding interface teaching programming fundamentals. Free app for tablets and computers.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Blockly, Visual Coding

name: Wonder Workshop - Wonder App
description: Beginner-friendly app with guided challenges and tutorials. Learn robotics through play-based activities. Perfect for home learning and independent exploration.

name: Wonder Workshop - Go App
description: Drive Dash and Dot robots like remote control vehicles. Introduction to robot control and spatial reasoning. Entry point for youngest learners.

name: Wonder Workshop - Path App
description: Programming through drawing paths for robots to follow. Visual programming introducing sequencing concepts. Bridge between direct control and block coding.
stem_fields: Computer Science, Programming, Sequencing, Visual Learning

name: Wonder Workshop - Xylo App
description: Program Dash robot to play xylophone accessory. Learn music, sequencing, and patterns through musical composition. STEAM integration with music.

name: Wonder Workshop - Wonder League Robotics Competition
description: Global robotics competition for K-8 students. Monthly challenges, showcase projects, and compete with students worldwide. Free participation building competition and presentation skills.

name: Wonder Workshop - Home Learning Resources
description: Curriculum and activities adapted for home use. Parent guides, project ideas, and structured learning paths for families. Support homeschool and after-school learning.

name: Wonder Workshop - Accessibility Features
description: Built-in accessibility features for diverse learners. Visual programming for non-readers, switch control support, and multi-sensory feedback. Inclusive robotics education.

name: Wonder Workshop - Multi-Language Support
description: Apps and curriculum available in multiple languages. Support English language learners and international classrooms. Global robotics education platform.
